title: UConn CyberSEED 2017
description: The Capture the Flag Challenge is an immersive, interactive competition that uses realistic IT infrastructure to simulate the current threat landscape. Designed for many levels of technical skill and experience, the competition puts participants in the hackers’ shoes to understand their technology and thought processes. Sponsored by Cisco, the Capture the Flag Challenge asks teams to attack a virtual corporate network in a series of progressively more difficult penetration exercises. The competition is intended for high-school and college teams. Participants have the opportunity to: Sharpen security skills such as forensics, penetration testing, and more Expand security awareness Learn and try new techniques Compete against their peers for prizes and bragging rights Comcast is providing travel support for teams to attend.
prizes:
First Place - $10,000
Second Place - $7,500
Third Place - $5,000

title: CyberSEED Social Engineering Competition 2017
description:
According to Social Engineer, Inc., 66 percent of all attacks by hackers, hacktivists and nation states include a social-engineering-attack vector. In this competition, teams will employ some of the most common tools and techniques of social engineering in order to gain access to the computing systems of a fictitious company. This challenge is a "capture the flag" style competition where flags are distributed online as well as on virtual computers and servers. Teams should be familiar with common tools and techniques of social engineers and bring with them one to three laptops capable of connecting to a Gb Ethernet switch, including any necessary dongles or Ethernet cables. Laptops should come configured with any preferred tools prior to the competition.

Sponsored by UConn and Comcast.
prizes:
First Place - $10,000
Second Place - $7,500
Third Place - $5,000

title: Pwn2Win CTF 2017
description:
Brazilian Thematic CTF, organized by ELT members. Jeopardy, involving subjects like Physics, Eletronics and PPC-M (PPC like Marathons) in addition to the traditional categories (Web/Crypto/Net/Rev/Pwn/Misc/PPC).

Registration is open, follow the instructions to sign up: https://github.com/pwn2winctf/2017. This year we'll be using a fully auditable platform based on Non-interactive Zero Knowledge (NIZK) proofs. All teams have a copy of the database and it is possible to independently audit submitted flags and scoreboard.

Read carefully how the competition will work: https://pwn2win.party/rules.

10/20/2017 (friday), to be started at 13:37 BRST (UTC -2), for 48 hours straight.

Twitter: twitter.com/eltctfbr
Facebook: facebook.com/capturetheflagbr
IRC: #tecland@freenode
prizes:
1º Place - 1000.00 BRL converted to BTC (*) + Certificates

2º and 3º Place - Certificates

(*) Converted to BTC by FoxBit rates at the working day just before the CTF opens.

The personalized certificates are just like "medals" from the event.

title: Oman National Cyber Security CTF Quals
description:
Oman CyberSecurity Competition (CTF) invites all cybersecurity talents and enthusiasts to take part in this competition to demonstrate their technical ability in cyber security field. Oman CyberSecurity Competition (CTF) organized by Information Technology Authority (ITA) and CyberTalents in collaboration with Arab Regional Cybersecurity Center (ARCC) and TrendMicro.
The winners are eligible to compete at regional and international CTFs representing Oman. The CTF will be a Jeopardy-Style CTF where every team will have a list of challenges in different categories like malware analysis, Web Security, Digital Forensics, Network Security and others. For every challenge solved, the team will get a certain amount of points depending on the difficulty of the challenge. The team who will get the highest score, will be the winning team.

title: WhiteHat Challenge 05
description:
WhiteHat Challenge is a CTF contest held periodically by WhiteHat.vn for beginners in learning or researching cybersecurity as system admins, students in technical schools, etc. It is to encourage the cybersecurity learning and researching, everyone can join, but only Vietnam teams receive awards. Teams have the chance to enroll in WhiteHat CTF Ranking.

WhiteHat CTF Ranking ranks teams in WhiteHat Challenge, WhiteHat Contest and WhiteHat Grand Prix with score top-down by year. WhiteHat Contest and WhiteHat Grand Prix are competitions for cybersecurity experts. The former is held twice a year, the latter is held periodically at the end of the year with grand prize.

WhiteHat.vn is the leading forum in Vietnam, where cybersecurity community exchanges expertise, ethics and law-related issues. It is a favorable environment to promote the learning and researching of cybersecurity lovers to follow the right path and become whitehat hackers, creating a community with high availability in troubleshooting incidents.
prizes:

Second prize: 2 million VND 
Third prize: 1 million VND

Only teams from Vietnam get the prizes.

title: Hack The Nexus - Blizzard CTF 2017
description:
Blizzard Entertainment Presents: Hack The Nexus CTF
On November 5th, 2017, Blizzard Entertainment will be hosting a one day onsite Capture The Flag (CTF) competition in Santa Ana, California. During the CTF, contestants will be solving different security challenges and puzzles ranging anywhere from forensics to exploitation. Prizes will be rewarded for the top three teams with the most points and also awarded for those teams that solve the hardest challenges. Full list of rules coming soon.

The CTF will be an onsite full day event and is free to participants. Team sizes will be between 3 - 4 members and signup must be completed with your whole team's information. Only one registration is required per team. Limited seats are available.  Visit http://hackthenexus.com/ for more details.

Why is Blizzard Entertainment having a Security CTF Event

Just like our passion for games, we love everything security. We wanted to create an event that would bring our local and global security communities closer together. What better way than to grab some drinks, hack on some challenges, and have fun!

Official Event Rules:  http://ctf.blizzard.com
prizes:
1st Place - $1,500
2nd Place - $1,000
3rd Place - $500
Extra Prizes for Top Challenges - $5000
Official Event Rules:  http://ctf.blizzard.com

https://codeblue.jp/2017/en

In addition we engage TokyoWesterns as the co-organizer to make the CTF more interesting and challenging.

title: DefCamp CTF Finals 2017
description: D-CTF 2017 is the main CTF competition for Defcamp, an international hacking & infosec conference. It’s all about teamwork, eyes wide open and remarkable skills. Every time it spreads the newest security techniques and supports measuring the security skills of the teams. A complete team covering all the main skills is always the best option to get into the finals. In the same time the competition does strengthen both technical and management skills; the leader is coordinating everything, every step from the process making sure that the team is following the line to capture the flag. Everything is doubled with mystery, mathematics and complicated algorithms to make everything even more challenging. All prizes applies for D-CTF Final 3.000 EUR cold cash, trophies & more surprises to come, free tickets for Defcamp 2016 to the finalists. http://dctf.def.camp

Challenges are specifically designed to point students in directions that will help them understand fundamental concepts and develop practical skills. Our sponsors are big players in the security field, who are serious about hiring the right people with the right skills. Our judges are world-renowned experts in the security field, who are dedicated to making sure that our challenges are designed to test these skills.

The final round for the CSAW CTF competition.

title: Trend Micro CTF 2017 - Raimund Genes Cup - The Final
description:
Test your knowledge in targeted attacks, Internet of Things (IoT), Industrial Control Systems (ICS), and other cybersecurity issues.
In our mission to make the world safe for exchanging digital information, we are launching CTF 2017 Raimund Genes Cup. It’s a cybersecurity competition that combines online qualifier and on-site finals. Top ten teams from the qualifier will enter the finals, hosted in Tokyo in November 2017. Program: Attack and Defense Teams are given their own environment to attack and defend against each other. Dates: November 11-12, 2017 Language: English (with Japanese support) Venue: BELLESALLE Nishi Shinjuku Participants: Top ten teams qualified from online qualifiers (Maximum four members per group) Automatic qualification: Winners from the following events are eligible for participating in Trend Micro CTF 2017 - Raimund Genes Cup - The Final Egypt National CTF
prizes:
Top ten teams from online qualifier will be eligible to join the final to be held in Tokyo on November 11-12 2017.
The top three teams from the final will claim the following prizes:
FIRST PLACE: - JPY1,000,000 (approximately USD9,000) for the winning team - ZDI Reward Points 15,000 points per player (equivalent of ZDI Bronze) for each member of the winning team, including 10% automatic monetary bonus on all vulnerability submissions over 2017, 10% ZDI Reward points multiplier on all vulnerability submissions over 2017, and one-time bonus of $2,000 - Automatic qualification for HITCON CTF 2017 Final to be hosted in Taipei in December 2017
SECOND PLACE: - JPY300,000 (Approximately USD2,700)
THIRD PLACE: - JPY200,000 (Approximately USD1,800)
EXPENSE COVERED BY TREND MICRO FOR TOP TEN TEAMS FROM ONLINE QUALIFIER - Three night accommodation for the duration of the event (accommodation arranged by Trend Micro) - Travel expense for a maximum of JPY200,000 (Approximately USD1,800) per team (conditions apply)

title: RHme3
description:
Riscure and Argus Cyber Security are happy to announce the third episode of Riscure Hack Me CTF, now with an automotive flavor.

RHME3 highlights:
• Embedded systems CTF created by Riscure in partnership with Argus Cyber Security.
• Allows participants and interested parties to enhance their knowledge of embedded systems security in general, and hardware security in particular.
• For the first time participants are provided with challenges that simulate real-life scenarios relevant to automotive cybersecurity: a group of challenges co-developed by Argus and Riscure utilizes CAN protocol commonly used in modern cars.
• A special Arduino-compatible custom board has been developed for the RHme3 challenge.
• The core of the board is an Atmel XMEGA that has four times the more memory and is twice as fast than the previous RHme boards.
• The RHme3 board also has a crypto-hardware accelerator and two CAN controllers, which allow a whole new range of challenges.

GirlsGoCyberStart is a CTF created to let girls "try out” cybersecurity to see what it's all about. CyberStart is a series of interactive challenges that explore exciting topics such as cryptography, penetration testing and digital forensics.  Girls form teams of up to 4 members , then collaborate in person or remotely as the competition is completely online.

Who can play: females enrolled in 9th- 12th grade at a public or private school or the homeschool equivalent.   High school must be located in one of these states or territories: American Samoa, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Hawaii, Indiana, Iowa, Maine, Maryland, Mississippi, Nevada, New Jersey, North Carolina, Texas, Vermont, West Virginia, Wyoming .
prizes: Top 3 teams win all-expenses paid trip to Chicago for WiCyS conference.  Top 3 in each state win prizes like Chromebook, Raspberry Pi with Touch Display, Beats Headphones and Cash.  Each winning school also gets money to support their STEM program.

title: PACTF 2018
description:
PACTF is an online computer security competition primarily for high school students, organized and run by students at Phillips Academy in Andover, MA, U.S.A. 

We will have more than than $20,000 in prizes.

PACTF will run from April 16–April 30. There will be two rounds, each one week long. During each round, your team can pick any two-day span to solve as many problems as you can.

Rounds will feature binary exploitation and reversing, cryptography, and other miscellaneous topics, with introductory and advanced problems in each category.

Our sponsors include Amazon, DigitalOcean, J.P. Morgan, ProtonMail, CyLab @ CMU, INI @ CMU, and the Tang Institute @ Phillips Academy Andover.

PACTF 2018 will be PACTF's third competition. Prior competitions can be viewed at https://2016.pactf.com and https://2017.pactf.com.

For more information about the competition, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PACTF.

title: STEM CTF: Cyber Challenge 2018
description:
In support of STEM outreach, MITRE and our partners are hosting the seventh annual national Capture the Flag (CTF) competition.

This CTF competition aims to encourage and promote interest in cybersecurity. United States-based High school and undergraduate college students will have the opportunity to compete in cybersecurity challenges to gain real-life experience and win national coverage to make a huge impact on our cyber talent pipelines.

Learn: Fundamental cyber knowledge by using online resources from MITRE and other publicly available reputable sources.

Understand: Binary exploitation and reversing, web exploitation, computer/network forensics, cryptography, critical infrastructure protection/exploitation and more!
Practice: Using Web resources and training challenges powered by the MITRE Cyber Academy.

Compete: Against students in high school and undergraduate universities across the nation.

Win: College scholarships and priority consideration for a cyber internship.

Notable industry and academic experts have partnered together to design rigorous challenges for students to solve. Participating in teams of four or five, students will gain valuable experience, skills and tools throughout this nationwide competition.
prizes:
College scholarships and priority consideration for a cyber internship.

While this competition is open to professional and government participants as part of cyber training, only eligible high school and college teams will be considered for winning prizes, scholarships and internships. Participation in a MITRE or Industry partner cyber internship program is subject to an interviewing process and based on current business needs.

title: NorthSec 2018
description:
Great Britain is investing massively in citizen tracking technologies. Cameras with face and licence plates tracking everywhere, statewide biometric databases, precrime AI.

Recently, talks about a “morality points” system has surfaced. At the same time, the space race to Mars is going strong, and Great Britain is looking good to be the first nation to set foot on the red planet.

No stranger to sending the “outcasts of society” somewhere far away, the government is planning on colonizing the planet with those people.

How are the morality points decided? Anyone going against the wishes of the government is susceptible to be sent away against their will. Activists beware.

description:
BI.ZONE is ready to announce the date of CTFZone quals 2018!
The first online stage will take place on July 21 at 9 AM (UTC) and will last for 36 hours. The stage format – Jeopardy – includes several categories: web, pwn, crypto, reverse, OSINT, PPC and forensics.

TOP-10 performers will proceed to the second offline stage of CTFZone, to be held this November in Moscow, Russia. BI.ZONE will provide necessary visa support and will cover travel and accommodation expenses for 5 lucky members of each team qualified for the finals.

The final fight will be in the classic Attack/Defence format.

Good luck to everyone and see you in July!

description:

title: HITB-XCTF GSEC CTF 2018 Final
description:
This year, HITB-XCTF GSEC CTF will again co-organized by HITB and XCTF League from China! An Attack & Defense Style CTF Competition is planned for the 30th and 31st of August alongside the conference.

The game is hosted on-site utilizing the CP-AD Contest Platform developed by CyberPeace Technology, China. Game challenges are authored by FlappyPig CTF Team, The Champion Team of 3rd XCTF International League.

For the on-site game, we have a capacity for a maximum of 16 teams (no more than 4 players per team). The game will run for 30 hours over the 2 days of the conference (30th & 31st August starting at 10:00SGT and ending at 18:00SGT on Day 1 and restarting on Day 2 at 10:00SGT and ends at 16:00SGT). The onsite contest will be hosted in the FREE TO ACCESS CommSec area of the conference. You do not need to be a paid conference delegate in order to compete.

description:

Capture The Flag, Codefest '18, invites all hackers to show off their skills on a global platform. It provides students with an opportunity to tackle computer security problems similar to real world scenarios. It aims to engage hackers, beginners and experienced alike in creative exploration of the real world computer security arena. This contest will let you learn and understand the importance of various roles and ramifications in the field of cyber security and will also help you appreciate various common security practices which are followed across the globe.

title: IceCTF 2018
description:
IceCTF is a computer security contest targeted at anyone with an interest in computer science. The game consists of a series of challenges where participants must reverse engineer, break, hack, decrypt, or do whatever it takes to solve the challenge. The challenges are all set up with the intent of being hacked, making it a great way to get some hands-on experience.

Challenge yourself and learn new concepts. You never really know how good you are at security and computer science until you really try it out. You might just win.

Don't know anything about computer science or cyber-security? Fear not. IceCTF is designed to accommodate both novice and advanced players alike. Many challenges will guide you to the right resources. As long as you're willing to learn and do a little research, most challenges should be within reach.

title: Hardwear.io NL 2018 Hardware CTF
description: The Hardware CTF organized by Quarkslab team is back for a second edition! Ever wondered how to break a smart lock? How to spy on embedded devices? How do car chips work? How to desolder and reball a flash chip? Then this CTF is for you! We've got plenty of challenges related to various themes such as RFID, Bluetooth, Automotive, Side-Channel Analysis, (de)Soldering, Radio, and much more. We will provide the hardware hacking tools you might need (Soldering Iron, Logic Analyzer, etc.) as well as guidance on how to use them. Just grab your PC and come try to solve our challenges. You'll have fun, learn new skills and who knows, maybe use these skills to break real embedded devices and propose a talk for next year! Challenges creation and CTF organization by Quarkslab. Prices offered by Hardwear.io.

title: Security Case Study CTF 2018
description:
Organizers – Polish Civil Cyber Defence Association, Cybersecurity Foundation

Format: on-site (offline)

Registration to the competition: Registration will run until the conference begins.
Please send the submissions to e-mail address  – contact (at) cybsecurity.org.
Each participant should also register using the form: https://www.securitycasestudy.pl/en/registration-2/

Duration – The competition will take place during the SCS conference. It will begin on September 13th at 12:00 and will end on September 14th at 12:00.
CTF will not be available between 13th September (20:00) and 14th September (8:00).

Teams – Any team consisting of individuals who have registered for the SCS17 conference can participate in the competition, including participants registered for a free part of the conference. Teams are limited to a maximum of three players. Each competitor can only be registered to one team. External help is forbidden. Teams participate in the contest at their own expense.

Logistics – The competition will take place in the dedicated area of the Sound Garden Hotel, where the SCS17 conference will take place. Participants will have a WiFi network, access to power sockets, tables and chairs. Lunch will be served for all CTF players.

Contact (e-mail) – contact (at) cybsecurity.org

title: CSAW CTF Qualification Round 2018
description:
Students tackle problems in a series of real-world scenarios modeling all sorts of computer security problems where, to succeed, they must demonstrate a profound understanding of the roles and ramifications of cyber security in these situations.

Because the challenges are designed to teach, CTF requires contestants to integrate concepts, develop skills and learn to hack as they go. Undergraduate finalists compete on-site for cash prizes, where their performance is judged by a panel of technical experts.
prizes: Top undergraduate teams will be invited to play in the finals round at multiple international sites. See https://csaw.engineering.nyu.edu/ctf/faq for full details.

title: Trend Micro CTF 2018 - Raimund Genes Cup - Online Qualifier
description:
Test your knowledge and skills in targeted attacks, Internet of Things (IoT), Industrial Control Systems (ICS), and other cybersecurity issues.

The competition is comprised of an online qualifying event and finals held in Tokyo, Japan in December 2018.

The online qualifier is in a “Jeopardy” format — players solve challenges in various cybersecurity categories. The top ten teams from the online qualifier will advance to compete in the final to be played with a combination of “attack and defense” and “Jeopardy” formats.

Online Qualifier
Program: “Jeopardy” Style
Dates: September 15 – 16, 2018
Duration: 24 hours
Start Time: 13:00 (JST) September 15, 2018
End Time: 13:00 (JST) September 16, 2018
Language: English
Venue: Online (requires internet connection)
Requirements: Must be over 20 years of age to participate

Final
Program: Attack and Defense
(King-of-the-Hill and“Jeopardy” Style)
Dates: December 15 - 16, 2018
Language: English (with Japanese support)
Venue: CIRQ – Tokyo, Japan
Participants: (Maximum four members per group)
Top ten (10) teams from the Online Qualifier
Automatic qualification: Winners from regional events are eligible for participating in Trend Micro CTF 2018 - Raimund Genes Cup - The Final
Arab Regional Cyber Security CTF Competition 2018
Latin America Regional CTF
Europe Regional CTF
Travel expenses covered for top ten teams:
Up to JPY 200,000* (approx. 1,800 USD) per team
Three nights accommodations** for the duration of the final
All team members must be age 20 or older to participate

* Conditions apply
** Accommodation arranged by Trend Micro
prizes:
The top ten teams from this online qualifier will advance to compete in the final held in Tokyo, Japan in December 2018.
Prizes

The top three teams will claim the following prizes after the final event hosted in Tokyo:

FIRST PLACE
JPY 1,000,000 (approx. USD 9,000) for the winning team
ZDI Reward Points 15,000 points per player (equivalent of ZDI Bronze) for each member of the winning team, including a USD 2,000 one-time monetary bonus.

SECOND PLACE
JPY 300,000 (approx. USD 2,600)

THIRD PLACE
JPY 200,000 (approx. USD 1,800)

A complete team covering all the main skills is always the best option to get into the finals. In the same time the competition does strengthen both technical and management skills; the leader is coordinating everything, every step from the process making sure that the team is following the line to capture the flag. Everything is doubled with mystery, mathematics and complicated algorithms to make everything even more challenging.

title: RITSEC CTF 2018
description:
RITSEC CTF 2018 is a security-focused competition that features the following categories: Binary, Crypto, Forensics, Programming, and Web.  We welcome beginners and more advanced security friends! There will be three brackets: RIT students, other college students, and everyone else. 

This event will run from November 16, 2018 @ 12:00 PM EST to November 18, 2018 @ 11:59 PM EST.
For RIT students, various companies will be adding some of their own challenges. If you solve a certain challenge, if you would like, we can connect you and the company who provided that challenge.

A little backstory for the name change - in 2016 and 2017, this event was run as "RC3 CTF".  RC3, a security club on campus at the Rochester Institute of Technology, merged with another security club - SPARSA - to form RITSEC.
prizes: Prizes will be awarded to the top 3 Rochester Institute of Technology student teams.

title: HITB-XCTF DUBAI CTF 2018
description:
This CTF is organized by XCTF League from China. This is a jeopardy-style CTF with multiple categories of challenges, including: reverse engineering, pwnable, web security, AI & blockchain, crypto, MISC (forensic, network analysis), etc

The game is hosted on-site and online utilizing the XCTF-OJ Platform developed by CyberPeace Technology, China. Game challenges are jointly authored by Blue-lotus CTF Team (core of Tea Deliverers, b1o0p CTF Team).

For the on-site game, we have a capacity for a maximum of 20 x 3-man teams. Your team MUST BE PRE-REGISTERED BEFORE GAME DAY AS COMPETING ON-SITE if you want to be eligible for the prizes. If you show up on the game day itself, you can still play the game (we have some additional space in the game arena or you can find somewhere to connect to the game server), but you will not be in the running to win any prizes. The game will run for 30 hours over the 2 days of the conference (27th & 28th November starting at 10:00GST and ending at 19:00GST on Day 1 and restarting on Day 2 at 10:00GST and ends at 17:00GST). The onsite contest will be hosted in the FREE TO ACCESS exhibition area of the conference. You do not need to be a paid conference delegate in order to compete.
prizes:
Prizes
1st Place – USD1500
2nd Place – USD1000
3rd Place  – USD500
The 1st place team will also be flown in to HITB2019 Amsterdam (May 9th and 10th), to compete in our 10th year anniversary CTF in The Netherlands.

title: Pwn2Win CTF 2018
description:
Brazilian Thematic CTF, organized by ELT members. Jeopardy, more multidisciplinary than usual and with many *unique* challenges in all categories. Brace yourselves!

Registration is now open, follow the instructions here: https://github.com/pwn2winctf/2018.

This year we'll be using a fully auditable platform based on Non-interactive Zero Knowledge (NIZK) proofs. All teams have a copy of the database and it is possible to independently audit submitted flags and scoreboard.

Read carefully how the competition will work: https://pwn2win.party/rules.

11/30/2018 (friday), to be started at 13:37 BRST (UTC -2), for 48 hours straight.

Twitter: twitter.com/eltctfbr
Facebook: facebook.com/capturetheflagbr
IRC: #pwn2win@freenode

The personalized certificates are just like "medals" from the event, something that you will use to testify your participation and Top 3 in this hardcore competition.

title: OverTheWire Advent Bonanza 2018
description:
Ho Ho Ho,

it's that time of year where many people count down the days to Christmas.

Traditionally, an advent calendar is used which yields one piece of chocolate every day, but
here at OverTheWire, we feel that we can do better than that.

Instead of chocolates, we offer a fresh CTF challenge every day of December until Christmas!

Format: remote, team-based, jeopardy.
Difficulty: intermediate (a couple hours solving time per challenge on average)
Categories: web, re, pwn, crypto, misc
Contact (IRC): #advent @ irc.overthewire.org
Contact (Twitter): @OverTheWireCTF

More information as the event comes closer at https://advent2018.overthewire.org

title: SOC Battle
description:
ARE YOU READY FOR AN EXTRAORDINARY CTF?
-FROM THE CREATORS OF THE GAME OF PWNERS-

SOC Battle is a CTF (Capture the Flag) competition which is organizing by Prisma CSI, Binalyze and Picus Security, and prepared for the SOC teams all over the world. It is completely free to join. Purpose of the competition is taking SOC teams to higher levels and give them a chance to compare themselves with the other SOC teams on all over the world through scenario based questions.

Only defence based questions will be included in the competition. Cyber security incidents, breaches and malwares that SOC teams can face in the real world will be turned into questions by the CTF team.

QUESTION CATEGORIES

FORENSICS
THREAT INTELLIGENCE
OPEN SOURCE INTELLIGENCE
MALWARE ANALYSIS
INCIDENT RESPONSE
CRYPTOLOGY
LOG MANAGEMENT

In each round, questions from the categories mentioned above will be prepared and given competitors to solve. The scores of the competition and rounds will be kept seperately. The team which reaches the highest point in total will be the winner of the competition.

title: Quals: Saudi and Oman National Cyber Security CTF
description:
This is the Qualification phase for Oman National Cyber Security CTF and Saudi Arabia Cyber Security CTF. Players should be living in either Sultanate Oman or Saudi Arabia to be able to participate in the finals of each Country. The CTF is a cybersecurity competition where participants demonstrate their technical ability in cyber security field. The CTF will be a Jeopardy Style CTF where every player will have a list of challenges in different categories like Reverse Engineering, Web Security, Digital Forensics, Network Security and others. For every challenge solved, the player will get a certain amount of points depending on the difficulty of the challenge.Best Players with highest score will qualify to the final round to form a team and compete physically

Competition is for individuals only Qualified players will be able to form teams in their Final CTFs Sharing flags between players is not allowed Players from other countries can participate for fun but they won't be eligible to play in the Final Round

title: STEM CTF: Cyber Challenge 2019
description:
In support of STEM outreach, MITRE and our partners are hosting the 8th annual national Capture the Flag (CTF) competition.

This CTF competition aims to encourage and promote interest in cybersecurity. United States-based High school and undergraduate college students will have the opportunity to compete in cybersecurity challenges to gain real-life experience and win national coverage to make a huge impact on our cyber talent pipelines.

Learn: Fundamental cyber knowledge by using online resources from MITRE and other publicly available reputable sources.

Understand: Binary exploitation and reversing, web exploitation, computer/network forensics, cryptography, critical infrastructure protection/exploitation and more!
Practice: Using Web resources and training challenges powered by the MITRE Cyber Academy.

Compete: Against students in high school and undergraduate universities across the nation.

Win: Priority consideration for a cyber internship.

Notable industry and academic experts have partnered together to design rigorous challenges for students to solve. Participating in teams of four or five, students will gain valuable experience, skills and tools throughout this nationwide competition.
prizes:
Priority consideration for a cyber internship.

While this competition is open to professional and government participants as part of cyber training, only eligible high school and college teams will be considered for internships. Participation in a MITRE or Industry partner cyber internship program is subject to an interviewing process and based on current business needs.

title: Nullcon Goa 2019 Hardware CTF
description: The Hardware CTF organized by Quarkslab team is back for a second edition! Ever wondered how to break a smart lock? How to spy on embedded devices? How do car chips work? How to desolder and reball a flash chip? Then this CTF is for you! We've got plenty of challenges related to various themes such as RFID, Bluetooth, Automotive, Side-Channel Analysis, (de)Soldering, Radio, and much more. We will provide the hardware hacking tools you might need (Soldering Iron, Logic Analyzer, etc.) as well as guidance on how to use them. Just grab your PC and come try to solve our challenges. You'll have fun, learn new skills and who knows, maybe use these skills to break real embedded devices and propose a talk for next year! Challenges creation and CTF organization by Quarkslab. Prices sponsored by Bosch.

title: Technex CTF 2019
description: Capture The Flag, Technex'19, organised by IIT (BHU) Varanasi, invites all hackers to show off their skills on a global platform. It provides students with an opportunity to tackle computer security problems similar to real world scenarios. It aims to engage hackers, beginners and experienced alike in creative exploration of the real world computer security arena. This contest will let you learn and understand the importance of various roles and ramifications in the field of cyber security and will also help you appreciate various common security practices which are followed across the globe.

title: Midnight Sun CTF 2019 Quals
description:
Midnight Sun CTF is HackingForSoju's annual CTF event to promote the cyber security eco-system in the Stockholm region. 

WHEN and WHERE

The final event is in June (15th-16th) in Stockholm, Sweden, with the online qualifier in April (5th-6th). 

QUALIFYING

The Open class is open to teams from anywhere in the world. The top seven teams of each class respectively proceed to the finals in Stockholm. In the Student class, four of the seven finals spots are reserved for teams from Swedish universities while the remaining three are reserved for teams from the Baltic Sea-8 countries (SE, FI, EE, LT, LV, PL, DE, DK)

Supported categories are Pwnable, Reverse, Web, Crypto, Misc.
prizes: The top 7 teams in each class qualify to the on-site finals in Stockholm in June.

SwampCTF is a student-run competition and hosted by the University of Florida Student InfoSec Team (UFSIT) a.k.a Kernel Sanders.

title: TG:Hack -delete me-
description:
TG:Hack is an onsite jeopardy style CTF with an offline highscore list uploaded to CTFtime. The CTF is hosted every year at Norway's largest LAN party The Gathering, which takes place at the Viking ship in Hamar. We focus on making guiding tasks for beginners, and challenging tasks for more experienced CTFers. 

We have a pre-contest for beginners, starting in February. The main competition starts 8th of April, 18.00 (CET), and ends 11th of April 18.00. 

After the main competition has ended, we open all tasks publicly for learning purposes. The site will be up until January 1st 2021. 

Writeups will be published at https://github.com/tghack after the competition has ended.

title: MIEM Real CTF Quals
description:
TG: t.me/realctf
VK: vk.com/hsectf

RealCTF is a CTF format competition from the HSE CTF team. RealCTF aims to provide participants to the reality of the search and exploitation of vulnerabilities in various areas and technologies as close as possible. Tasks await you in both familiar areas like reverse, crypto, web, and new ones, such as industrial technologies and smart cards.
 
Do you want to test your skills in infomation security, meet like-minded people and have a cool time? 
 
Gather a team of 3 to 7 people, register on the site real.hsectf.ru (specify the real data) and get a chance to get to on-site stage of the competition!

By the way, the winners are automatically qualified for the final of the international VolgaCTF.
prizes:
Respect and qualification to MIEM Real CTF that will be 18-19th May in Moscow, Russia.

$1000 for the first place, if the command will participate in Finals!

title: TG:Hack 2019
description:
TG:Hack is a (semi) onsite jeopardy style CTF hosted every year at Norway's largest LAN party The Gathering, which takes place at the Viking ship in Hamar. We focus on making guiding tasks for beginners, and challenging tasks for a little more experienced CTFers. 

We have a pre-contest for beginners, starting 15th of February. The main competition starts 17th of April, 18.00 (CET), and ends 20th of April 18.00. 

By semi-onsite CTF, we mean that some of our tasks are published publicly and some are only for onsite participants. This is in order to meet The Gatherings' requirements to only make onsite participants able to win prizes and make it more exclusive to participate onsite. The 'hard' and 'crazy' difficulties will only be published for onsite participants

After the main competition has ended, we open all tasks publicly for learning purposes. The site will be up until January 1st 2020. 

Writeups will be published at https://github.com/tghack after the competition has ended.
prizes: Only for onsite participants

title: HITB CTF Amsterdam 2019
description:
Chronologists, Time travelers and  Fellow Futurologists,

Join us at our exhibition on creative technical fiasco’s through the ages: the Chronicles of Total Failure.

In this exposé, you will find the finest selection of interactive calamities, tragedies and  faux pas that once haunted the pioneers of the cyber technology frontier.

Cringe at the clutter once called “The Cloud”!
Tremble at tortured mixtures of code and data!
Feel the claustrophobia of IPv4!

But most of all, test your knowledge of archeologic trivia and your skill with ancient technologies against the best minds that time and space has to offer!

Entry to the exhibition is limited to a maximum of 27 parties, with no party exceeding 3 attendees.
prizes:
1st Place – USD1500
2nd Place – USD1000
3rd Place  – USD500

title: NorthSec 2019
description:
Our applied security contest (also called CTF as in "Capture The Flag") is the world's biggest on-site: it opposes 75 teams of 8 people trying to obtain the most points by capturing flags.

Those flags typically are secret messages hidden in different challenges.

The Challenges will be available to teams through a web portal on their own private contest network, they are not authorized to attack each other (it's not a red/blue team type of contest), they compete to have the most points on the leaderboard.

Challenges also include physical aspect of security: lockpicking, key impressionning, social engineering, hardware/soldering challenges.
prizes:
1st Place: $1600 for the table + Gold Challenge Coins
2nd Place: $1200 for the table + Silver Challenge Coins
3rd Place: $800 for the table + Bronze Challenge Coins

Tons of raffled prizes.

title: Hardwear.io USA 2019 Hardware CTF
description: The Hardware CTF organized by Quarkslab team is there for the USA first time! Ever wondered how to break a smart lock? How to spy on embedded devices? How do car chips work? How to desolder and reball a flash chip? Then this CTF is for you! We've got plenty of challenges related to various themes such as RFID, Bluetooth, Automotive, Side-Channel Analysis, (de)Soldering, Radio, and much more. We will provide the hardware hacking tools you might need (Soldering Iron, Logic Analyzer, etc.) as well as guidance on how to use them. Just grab your PC and come try to solve our challenges. You'll have fun, learn new skills and who knows, maybe use these skills to break real embedded devices and propose a talk for next year! Challenges creation and CTF organization by Quarkslab. Prices sponsored by Microsoft Security.
prizes:
Winner:
  • Chipwhisperer
  • Saleae Logic
  • Jtagulator
  • Proxmark3
  • Ubertooth
  • NoStarch Book
  • T-Shirt
First Runner Up:
  • Chipwhisperer
  • Saleae Logic
  • Jtagulator
  • Hydrabus + HydraNFC
  • NoStarch Book
  • T-Shirt

title: Midnight Sun CTF 2019 Finals
description:
Midnight Sun CTF is HackingForSoju's annual CTF event to promote the cyber security eco-system in the Stockholm region. 

WHEN and WHERE 
The final event is in June (15th-16th) in Stockholm, Sweden, with the online qualifier in April (5th-6th).

title: Google Capture The Flag 2019 (Quals)
description:
Please send us detailed FEEDBACK: 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSenlLYqhEmzCE7CsoYONecF-V8CCjg-KlCPXTwuQshckCuKGA/viewform

1. The registration page has been opened. You can register on our website https://ctf.isitdtu.com/
2. Date and time: 18:00 ICT 29 June - 18:00 ICT 30 June.
3. This ctf is an online jeopady ctf, runs for 24 hours.

title: Canadian Institute for Cybersecurity_Capture the Flag
description: CIC is inviting all undergraduate Computer Science, Software Engineering and Information Technology Students across Canada to participate “Individually” in a CTF online competition qualifier in June.

The top 20 qualifying students will be invited to the final online contest in August. The top 3 finalists will be invited to the 17th Annual International Conference on Privacy, Security and Trust (PST2019), August 26-28, 2019 in Fredericton, New Brunswick to receive their prize.

Prizes:

The top 3 finalists will receive a full stipend to study Master of Applied Cybersecurity (MACSec) at CIC/UNB.

title: WCTF 2019 ONLINE
description:
Founded in June, 2016, WCTF invites the world’s best CTF teams and security experts to gather together on this hacking fest. 

Challenges are submitted by CTF teams who were invited to Onsite WCTF and 360 Security Teams. 

 WCTF 2019 Online will last only 2 days and the final score will be based on how many challenges teams have solved. For more information, please visit our official website: https://ctf.360.com/index_en.html

 

Deadline for Registration: UTC 15:00, July 3th.
prizes: Top three teams will be awarded with 3,000 USD, 2,000 USD and 1,000 USD.

title: ENOWARS 3
description:
They don't let us think for ourselves.
The Internet is under constant surveillance, firewalled and ruled by fake accounts and spam bots.
Once glorious, CTFtime.org is now buried.
For our counter attack, ENOFLAG calls upon you, - the most powerful hackers - to join us in this fight.
To find the chosen one, ENOFLAG hosts a shady underground tournament, "ENOWARS 3".
Armed with advanced cyber weapons and human brains, teams from around the world try their best to save mankind.
But can they patch malicious services and restore the web to its former ? 

Registration URL: https://enowars.com/register.html
prizes: 1st place gets 512 € (provide write ups pls)

title: CInsects CTF 2019
description:
The CTF will consist of multiple challenges/services involving multiple virtual machines. The team's virtual machines are hosted by us. They may will have different operating systems.

The level of access to the different virtual machines is different for each scenario and virtual machine.

The teams can start, stop and reset their own virtual machines.

description:

There is a flag associated with each level. To successfully complete the level you have to get the flag and submit.

HackCon is a part of our college's technical fest - ESYA. Facebook link for the event: https://www.facebook.com/events/1757683244375570/

description: Capture The Flag, Codefest'19 invites all hackers to show off their skills on a global platform. It provides students with an opportunity to tackle computer security problems similar to real world scenarios. It aims to engage hackers, beginners and experienced alike in creative exploration of the real world computer security arena. This contest will let you learn and understand the importance of various roles and ramifications in the field of cyber security and will also help you appreciate various common security practices which are followed across the globe.

title: Affinity CTF 2019 - Quals
description:
Affinity Capture The Flag (CTF) contest will consist of a set of IT/security/computer/digital related challenges and riddles for participants to solve. It consists of two rounds: Qualifications and The Final. The final round will consist of an on-site contest, where selected teams will compete to solve additional set of challenges.

Sponsors: Akamai Technologies Poland

Timeline:
1 September 2019: Registration start at 18:00 UTC
6 September 2019: Qualifications start at 18:00 UTC
8 September 2019: End of qualifications at 18:00 UTC
7 November 2019: Conference and the final round
prizes:

Invitation for the finals and the Affinity conference (https://www.akamaiaffinity.com/) - 3 admission tickets per team.

In the Final:
·       1st place: Around $500 material prize for every member of the final team

·       2nd place: Around $250 material prize for every member of the final team

·       3rd place: Around $125 material prize for every member of the final team

·       4th place: Around $20 material prize for every member of the final team (t-shirt, cup, or small device)

title: Trend Micro CTF 2019 - Raimund Genes Cup - Online Qualifier
description:
5th Annual Trend Micro CTF Competition!

Test your knowledge and skills in targeted attacks, Internet of Things (IoT), Reversing, Mobile, and other cybersecurity issues.



The competition is comprised of an online qualifying event in September and finals held in Tokyo, Japan in November 2019.



The online qualifier is in a “Jeopardy” format — players solve challenges in various cybersecurity categories. The top ten teams from the online qualifier will advance to compete in the final to be played with a Dynamic Value “Jeopardy” format.



Online Qualifier

Program: “Jeopardy” Style

Dates: September 7 -8, 2019

Duration: 24 hours

Start Time: 13:00 (JST) September 7, 2019

End Time: 13:00 (JST) September 8, 2019

Language: English

Venue: Online (requires internet connection)

Requirements: Must be over 20 years of age to participate



Final

Program: Dynamic Value "Jeopardy” Style

Dates: November 23 - 24, 2019

Language: English (with Japanese support)

Venue: Tokyo, Japan

Participants: (Maximum four members per group)

All team members must be age 20 or older to participate
prizes: Prizes TBD - please see site for more details.

title: DefCamp CTF Qualification 2019
description:
D-CTF is the traditional Capture the Flag Jeopardy style competition organised during DefCamp international cyber security & hacking conference happening in Bucharest, Romania between 7th and 8th of November. The competition has two phases:
- September 7th - September 8th, Online Qualification (24h) 
- November 7th - 8th, The Final in Bucharest, Romania with best teams from Online Qualifications 

Because challenges are inspired by real life scenarios from day-to-day challenges of industry experts and other CTF players, you have to prove the ability to develop skills and under stress. It will be fun, I promise! :-)
prizes:
Qualification Round: 
- 10-15 teams will be invited to fight for supremacy in Bucharest, Romania at the D-CTF 2019 Final
- free tickets for DefCamp 2019 to the finalists 
- full or partial accommodation reimbursement tbc

The Final: 
-  4,500 EUR cold cash 
- gadgets, wearables & hardware 
- trophies & more surprises to come

title: Security Case Study CTF 2019
description:
Registration to the competition: Registration will run until the conference begins. Please send the submissions to e-mail address – kamil.gapinski (at) cybsecurity.org. Each participant should also register using the form: https://www.securitycasestudy.pl/rejestracja/

Duration – The competition will take place during the SCS conference. It will begin on September 12th at 12:00 and will end on September 13th at 12:00. CTF will not be available between 12th September (18:00) and 13th September (10:00).

Teams – Any team consisting of individuals who have registered for the SCS19 conference can participate in the competition, including participants registered for a free part of the conference. Teams are limited to a maximum of three players. Each competitor can only be registered to one team. External help is forbidden. Teams participate in the contest at their own expense.

Logistics – The competition will take place in the dedicated area of the Sound Garden Hotel, where the SCS19 conference will take place. Participants will have a WiFi network, access to power sockets, tables and chairs.

Contact (e-mail) – contact (at) cybsecurity.org
prizes:
TOP 1 – 7500 PLN
TOP 2 – 4500 PLN
TOP 3 – 1500 PLN

title: Timisoara CTF 2019 Quals
description:
Timisoara CTF is an international jeopardy-style cybersecurity competition, dedicated to high-school students, community-organized in Timisoara, Romania, under Banat IT Association’s coordination.

The online qualifier round will start on 13th of September 17:00 EEST and will end on 17th of September 21:00 EEST.

Eligible participants should be high school students (including those who graduated in 2019) younger than 20 on the day of the final competition, grouped in teams of 1-4 members, able to travel to Timisoara on the 16th of November. Non eligible participants can play on a separate scoreboard.

title: CSAW CTF Qualification Round 2019
description:
CSAW CTF is an entry-level, jeopardy style CTF, designed for students who are trying to break into the field of security. Challenges are meant to exhibit fundamental concepts and help students develop their skills. If you have never played a CTF before, check out “Preparation Resources & Tools” below.

Our competition occurs over two rounds: an online Qualifying Round in September and a Final in-person Round in November.

https://csaw.engineering.nyu.edu/ctf/faq

title: Zia CTF 2019
description: A cybersecurity Capture the Flag (CTF) event for New Mexico college students. This CTF challenges participants to solve cybersecurity-related puzzles of increasing difficulty in different categories such as cryptography, protocol analysis, reverse engineering, and data forensics. It’s online, mentor-assisted, and designed to be worked at your own pace, making it a great opportunity for students of all levels to learn new cybersecurity skills, network with their peers across New Mexico.

title: Real World CTF 2019 Quals
description:
The Real World CTF 2019, which is in jeopardy style, has an
on-line qualification round followed by an on-site, hands-on
final round in China where all challenges are built on top of
real world applications. Our contest is open to players around
the global and everyone, every team is highly welcome to play
in the qualification round.
Top 12 teams (5 players per team) with the highest score from
the qualification round will be invited to participate in the
final round. We will see the world's best teams competing for
the Real World CTF 2019 Championship.

title: Newark Academy CTF 2019
description: Newark Academy CTF (NACTF) is an online jeopardy-style cybersecurity competition hosted by Newark Academy's Computer Science Club. Form teams with up to 5 members and participate online for free at www.nactf.com. Teams compete to decrypt, hack, or reverse engineer challenges in topics like cryptography, forensics, and binary exploitation. NACTF will run from Tuesday, September 17th 22:00 UTC to Sunday, September 22rd 22:00 UTC. Participation is open to anyone but prizes are restricted to US middle school and high school students. Register now to get ready for the competition to begin!
prizes:
Anyone may participate in NACTF, however there are restrictions on eligibility for prizes. In order to receive prizes, all team members must be US middle school or high school students.

1st place: $125
2nd place: $100
3nd place: $75
4th-7th place: $50
8th-10th place: $25

Thank you to Trail of Bits https://www.trailofbits.com for providing the competition prizes! Check out their blog https://blog.trailofbits.com and follow them on twitter @trailofbits to learn about state-of-the-art cybersecurity!

title: SEC-T CTF 2019
description:
SEC-T is non-profit, annual IT security conference held in Stockholm, Sweden. The date is September 18th, 15:00 UTC - September 19th 2019, 21:00 UTC (31h). Supported categories are Pwnable, Reverse, Web, Crypto, Misc. The CTF is both remote and local, only local teams can win prizes.

More information at https://www.sec-t.org/ and https://twitter.com/sectctf

title: Hardwear.io CTF Netherlands 2019
description:
The Hardwear.io CTF organized by Quarkslab team is coming to the 5th anniversary edition of hardwear.io.

Ever wondered - How to break a smart lock? How to spy on embedded devices? How do car chips work? How to (de)solder and reball a flash chip?

Then this CTF is for you!

We've got plenty of challenges related to various themes such as RFID, Bluetooth, automotive, side-channel analysis, (de)soldering, radio, and much more. We will provide the hardware hacking tools you might need (soldering iron, logic analyzer, ...) as well as guidance on how to use them.

Just grab your PC and come try to solve our challenges. You'll have fun, learn new skills and who knows, maybe use these skills to break real embedded devices and propose a talk for next year!

Requirements:
A PC with Linux is needed for some of the challenges, but we've also some other ones that can be done without a PC.

How to Participate:
Once the CTF is open, come to our booth, register a new team and start playing.

CTF Time:
The CTF will be open from 26/09/2019 10:00 to 27/09/2019 16:45.

Register for the conference:
https://hardwear.io/netherlands-2019/register.php
prizes:
1st Winner:
USD 1000 Cash
Hardwear.io Netherlands 2020 Corporate Conference Pass
Hardwear.io CTF T-shirt

2nd Winner:
USD 500 Cash
Hardwear.io Netherlands 2020 Corporate Conference Pass
Hardwear.io CTF T-shirt

3rd Winner:

Hardwear.io CTF T-shirt

title: picoCTF 2019
description:
True to all picoCTF's before it, picoCTF 2019 excelled at providing helpful learning ramps for people investigating cyber security for the first time, but also provided some difficult challenges to test the saltiest cyber security expert's chops.

The video game aspect of picoCTF 2019 was incredibly well-received and besides a lit soundtrack, it provided mini-games that could unlock super-hints for a handful of challenges.

picoCTF 2019 improved upon the Classroom feature from the previous year, allowing instructors to create up to 20 classrooms and add students quickly using batch registration via a comma separated values file.
prizes:
1st place: $6,000 and may have opportunity to visit Carnegie Mellon University’s Pittsburgh campus for an award ceremony
2nd place: $3,500 and may have opportunity to visit Carnegie Mellon University’s Pittsburgh campus for an award ceremony
3rd place: $2,500 and may have opportunity to visit Carnegie Mellon University’s Pittsburgh campus for an award ceremony
4th place: $1,000
5th place: $1,000

title: PwnThyBytes CTF 2019
description:
Update your tools, stock up on energy drinks and turn off all of your notifications 'cause we've got some badass CTF tasks coming your way, guaranteed to keep you plugged in, jacked up, glued down but ultimately knocked out.
You're looking down the barrel of 40 hours of some serious mayhem including but not limited to: mind-bending memory corruption, bewildering binary reversing, convoluted cryptography, feral forensics, and wacky web.
We'll do our best to ensure PTBCTF engages you by making you dive into arcane secrets of known software or tackle new challenges that expand your knowledge.

Expect:
- Mostly hard and very hard challenges
- Prizes: 2048 €, 1024 €, 512 € for the top 3 teams
- Approximately 30 tasks to be gradually opened
- Discord-based comm
- Dynamic scoring (CTFd or similar)

Do not expect:
- Guessing challenges
- Untested challenges
- Breakthrough points (no reason to give advantage to teams based on timezone)
prizes:
First place: 2048 €
Second place: 1024 €
Third place: 512 €

title: Syskron Security CTF 2019
description:
The Syskron Security CTF (Capture The Flag) event is a free online cyber security competition for everyone, but especially for school and university students. We will provide 20+ challenges focused on industrial security (all levels of difficulty).

There will be the following categories at least:

– OSINT: It’s all about Open Source Intelligence. You don’t need any special tools here, but a basic search engine and ideas.
– Crypto: This ranges from modern encryption algorithms to old-school pen and paper decryption.
– Forensics: Data breaches, dictionary attacks, log file analysis – find the flag. And … do you know pcap files, and Wireshark? This would be helpful.
– Trivia: Facts you always wanted to know about industrial security.
– Secret: There is also a hidden secret. Unlock it by solving challenges.
– Fun: Everything that doesn’t fit in categories mentioned above.

title: Reply Cyber Security Challenge 2019
description:
>>> The event will start at 19:30 CEST! <<<

Reply will once again be hosting its Reply Cyber Security Challenge, a team competition open to both students and professionals. The online challenge will take place on Friday October 11th 2019 at 19:30 CEST and will last 24 hours. 

After the first event last year, in which over 6,200 people from 61 countries around the world took part, the 2019 challenge will present five stimulating issues for each of the following categories: coding, web, miscellaneous, crypto and binary. The team that solves the security problem in a ‘capture the flag’ (CTF) contest will obtain the highest score in the challenge and win the challenge.

Designed by the Keen Minds team, Reply’s cyber security experts, the Cyber Security Challenge is just one of a number of Reply initiatives to promote the culture of coding, with a particular focus on new generations.

For more information about the event, visit challenges.reply.com.

title: Deloitte UK CTF Qualifiers
description:
For the 5th successive year, Deloitte's annual 'Capture the Flag' competition is back. Targeting selected universities across the UK the event is a fantastic opportunity for students to develop and demonstrate their technical and advisory cyber-skills.

This competition tests students' penetration testing, forensics, malware and intrusion analysis skills in a fun and competitive environment.
 
There are two events: A qualifying round hosted remotely, followed by an all-day final for the top scoring teams only.

You must be a registered student to join and will compete against other UK-based university teams.

As well as cash prizes for the top 3 teams, the winning team members will each receive a limited-edition Deloitte CTF challenge coin.
prizes: Prizes: Top 8 teams gain entry to final.

title: CSAW CTF Final Round 2019
description:
CSAW CTF is a entry-level CTF, designed for undergraduate students who are trying to break into security. Challenges are specifically designed to point students in directions that will help them understand fundamental concepts and develop practical skills. Our sponsors are big players in the security field, who are serious about hiring the right people with the right skills. Our judges are world-renowned experts in the security field, who are dedicated to making sure that our challenges are designed to test these skills.

The final round for the CSAW CTF competition.

description:
Affinity Capture The Flag (CTF) contest will consist of a set of IT/security/computer/digital related challenges and riddles for participants to solve. It consists of two rounds: Qualifications and The Final. The final round will consist of an on-site contest, where selected teams will compete to solve additional set of challenges.

Sponsors: Akamai Technologies Poland

Timeline:
1 September 2019: Registration start at 18:00 UTC
6 September 2019: Qualifications start at 18:00 UTC
8 September 2019: End of qualifications at 18:00 UTC
7 November 2019: Conference and the final round
prizes:
·       1st place: Around $500 material prize for every member of the final team

·       2nd place: Around $250 material prize for every member of the final team

·       3rd place: Around $125 material prize for every member of the final team

·       4th place: Around $20 material prize for every member of the final team (t-shirt, cup, or small device)

title: DefCamp CTF Finals 2019
description: D-CTF 2019 is the main CTF competition for DefCamp, an international hacking & INFOSEC conference. It’s all about teamwork, eyes wide open and remarkable skills. Every time it spreads the newest security techniques and supports measuring the security skills of the teams. A complete team covering all the main skills is always the best option to get into the finals. In the same time the competition does strengthen both technical and management skills; the leader is coordinating everything, every step from the process making sure that the team is following the line to capture the flag. Everything is doubled with mystery, mathematics and complicated algorithms to make everything even more challenging.
prizes: All prizes applies for D-CTF Final 4.500 EUR cold cash, trophies & more surprises to come, free tickets for Defcamp 2019 to the finalists. http://dctf.def.camp

title: Pwn2Win CTF 2019
description:
Brazilian Thematic CTF, organized by ELT members. Jeopardy, more multidisciplinary than usual and with many *unique* challenges in all categories. Brace yourselves!

Registration is now open, follow the instructions here: https://github.com/pwn2winctf/2019/.

This year we'll be using a fully auditable platform based on Non-interactive Zero Knowledge (NIZK) proofs. All teams have a copy of the database and it is possible to independently audit submitted flags and scoreboard.

Read carefully how the competition will work: https://pwn2win.party/rules.

If you want to help us promoting the event, see the illustration of this year's story: https://pwn2win.party/assets/artes/Pwn2Win-2019.jpg

November 08 (friday), to be started at 13:37 BRT (UTC -3), for 48 hours straight.

Twitter: @eltctfbr and @pwn2win
Facebook: facebook.com/capturetheflagbr
IRC: #pwn2win@freenode
prizes:
The winner will be invited to the next edition of Pro CTF (the previous edition of the event had a prize pool of US$ 100,000 -> https://ctftime.org/event/918).

Top 1: Internet Fame level Gold + Awesome T-Shirts + Personalized Certificates + Invitation to the next Pro CTF
Top 2: Internet Fame level Silver + Awesome T-Shirts + Personalized Certificates + 1 LTC
Top 3: Internet Fame level Bronze + Awesome T-Shirts + Personalized Certificates + 1 LTC

The personalized certificates are just like "medals" from the event, something that you will use to testify your participation and Top 3 in this hardcore competition.

For specific prizes for brazilian academic teams, see https://pwn2win.party/regras.

Using an environment running Kali Linux, participants are encouraged to use various resources and tools to “hack” the answers to the puzzles. This introduction allows the students to get a feel for the different aspects for cybersecurity.

description:
For the 5th successive year, Deloitte's annual 'Capture the Flag' competition is back. Targeting selected universities across the UK the event is a fantastic opportunity for students to develop and demonstrate their technical and advisory cyber-skills.

This competition tests students' penetration testing, forensics, malware and intrusion analysis skills in a fun and competitive environment.

There are two events: A qualifying round hosted remotely, followed by an all-day final for the top scoring teams only.

You must be a registered student to join and will compete against other UK-based university teams.

As well as cash prizes for the top 3 teams, the winning team members will each receive a limited-edition Deloitte CTF challenge coin

Address: Deloitte LLP, 2 New St Square, Holborn, London EC4A 3BZ
prizes:
1st : £3000, 
2nd : £2000, 
3rd : £1000. 

Challenge coins awarded to top team and winner of physical challenge.

final round. We will see the world's best teams competing for
the Real World CTF 2019 Championship.

title: watevrCTF 2019
description:
Welcome to watevrCTF 2019!

watevrCTF is a security capture the flag competition for everyone, whether you are just starting out or have already played a fair amount of CTF competitions before. Our aim is to provide quality challenges that do not require unreasonable guessing to solve.

A CTF competition is a cybersecurity competition where you get to solve lots of computer-related puzzles and challenges. Each challenge contains a string called a flag, which you must find and submit to this website to receive points.

The event takes place online during a 48h period between December 13th 19:00 UTC and December 15th 19:00 UTC.

Registration is now open! Register your team at https://ctf.watevr.xyz/

The flag format is watevr{example_flag} unless specified otherwise.

This CTF has dynamic scoring. The score function is round(10 + 490 / (1 + (solves - 1) / 12)) for all challenges.

Join our discord server here: https://discord.gg/GSSAaqD
prizes:
prizes for this CTF are as follows:
1st place: a Raspberry Pi 4 2GB RAM + an RTL-SDR dongle + a reasonably priced domain name
2nd place: a Raspberry Pi 4 2GB RAM + an RTL-SDR dongle
3rd place: a Raspberry Pi 4 2GB RAM

To be eligible to receive prizes you must meet all of the following criteria:

- You are not affiliated with any of our sponsors
- At least 70% of your teams members are located in Sweden
- Your team has less than or equal to 7 members

title: X-MAS CTF 2019
description:
X-MAS CTF 2019 is HTsP's second installment of X-MAS CTF. We welcome both beginners and experienced players alike.
We hope that you will have a great time and we wish you a Merry Christmas! (All of the challenges are written by HTsP members)

What to expect from 2019's X-MAS CTF:
• Unique and enjoyable types of challenges
• A new, custom platform: CTFx (https://gitlab.com/Milkdrop/ctfx)     
• One-week-long competition
• Prizes! (You should check out our sponsors, they're doing an amazing job :) )

Proudly Sponsored by : 
- - HackTheBox (https://www.hackthebox.eu/)
- - TryHackMe (https://tryhackme.com/)

The following rules apply for the X-MAS CTF 2019:
• Attacking the web server is strictly prohibited and will get you disqualified.
• The flag format is X-MAS{1337_Str1ng}, unless specified otherwise.
• The competition will be over on Fri, 20 Dec. 2019 at 19:00 UTC but the challenges will be online for the following 2-3 days afterwards.
• Bruteforcing the flag will not get you anywhere except on the blacklist.
• Any questions regarding challenges or the platform should be sent to xmasctf.contact@gmail.com.

Join our official Discord channel for further details:
https://discord.gg/9dwXTKF
prizes:
1. 3 Months ProLab voucher or 1 year HackTheBox VIP subscription (you choose)
2. 2 Months ProLab voucher or 1 year HackTheBox VIP subscription (you choose)
3. 1 Month ProLab voucher or 1 year HackTheBox VIP subscription (you choose)

Top 3 teams also receive in addition a free 1 month TryHackMe subscription.

Note: Only a maximum of 4 members per team can receive prizes.

title: BITSCTF 2020
description:
UPDATE: This event has been postponed, and will not be taking place in the given timeline. We will relist the event when its dates are final. We apologize for the inconvenience.

BITSkrieg presents BITSCTF 2020!

1. Duration is of 48 hours.
2. Max team size is of 5.
3. Scoring system will be dynamic.
4. There will be a dedicated discord server for contacting the CTF admins.
5. The participants must provide a real point of contact for future notifications and to claim their prizes.
6. Participants behaving inappropriately will be immediately disqualified. This includes (but isn't limited to):
- Sharing solutions or hints on the designated discord channel.
- Attacking computers or applications not designated by the competition.
- General brute force attacks over online platform unless specified.
- Other things we consider to be unfair.
7. In cases of possible inappropriate behaviour, the decision of the CTF admin will be final.
prizes:

2nd Place: 100 USD
3rd Place: 50 USD

title: Codegate CTF 2020 Preliminary
description:
① Qualification f participation
- The number of participants in final: 4 members at maximum
- The final participants must be chosen among less than 10 people, when registering the preliminary.
- The written infmation in the preliminary registration process, must belong to the participant, himself. (Identification of infmation is required in the phase of final.)
- The identical team is restricted to participate again, in the final contest in general university departments.
② Final Qualifying
- Top 10th ranked teams of preliminary round will go on to the final match
- The final team is supposed to submit the question solving rept within a week, after the result announcement of preliminary contest, the submitted rept will be notified through website.
③ Rule on site
- It is possible to nullify the entire procedures which were done without valid certification in the contest server.
- The entire team team members who have certified the key value through an inappropriate sharing with people besides the final contest participants will be disqualified, regardless of the contest results.
- If the improper behavi is caught, qualification f participation will be stripped away by the authity decision of the contest operation management. the person concerned will also be deprived of the qualification f participation f 3 years later in the CODEGATE contest

title: Capture The Flag - Incredia
description:
Capture The Flag is an information security competition that challenges you to solve a variety of tasks ranging from a scavenger hunt to basic programming exercises, to hacking your way into a server to steal data.

Round 1 will be a jeopardy style CTF. You will be given various problems under Forensics,Steganography, Cryptography and Web Exploitations. Points will be assigned based on the difficulty of the problem. Teams with the most points will move forward to Round 2

Round 2 will be a King of the Hill style CTF. You will be provided with various systems with varying levels of difficulty. You are supposed to hack into them and change a file which in turn will make the system yours. You can defend your system without changing any network or firewall rules


Location: NMAM Institute of Technology, Nitte, Karkala, Udupi, Karnataka, India

Note: 
1. You need to have an Incredia PID.
2. The team members should all be from the same academic institution 


Event Timings: 17th Feb 2:00PM IST to 17th Feb 5:00PM IST
prizes:

2nd prize - Rs. 5,000

title: RundergroundCTF #1.1
description:
Online open-to-all Attack-Defence Blitz.

This event is an experiment and will be UNRATED.

Blitz format is a modification of a classic Attack-Defence with an aim to be more dynamic. There’ll be only 1 service, 2 players in each team (only 2 OpenVPN configs will be provided per team) and the game is much shorter, only 2 hours of open network time.

Service language will be Python.

Everything will be cloud-hosted using OpenVPN to access the game network. 

To register, text this Telegram bot: https://t.me/cbsctf_bot.

The main competition chat is https://t.me/cbsctf. It's mostly Russian-speaking, but feel free to use any language or DM admins in case of any issues. There's also an English-speaking chat here: https://t.me/cbsctf_en.  Channel with game notifications: https://t.me/cbsctf_c.

title: riftCTF
description:
For the first time, IIIT Naya Raipur is organizing a Capture The Flag event i.e. RiftCTF.
This event intends to bring general awareness about hacking and to break the stigma surrounding the field, meanwhile motivating and challenging those who are interested in cybersecurity or working in the field. It is a beginner-friendly CTF for those who want to start into the field of CTF's.

RiftCTF is a beginner friendly  jeopardy style CTF Sponsored by Pentesterlabs. It has a couple of challenges (tasks) in a range of categories. For example,Forensic, Crypto, Steganography, OSINT, Reverse engineering etc. The team can gain points for every solved task. More points for more complicated tasks. After the time(24 Hrs) is over the sum of points and time of submission will decide the CTF winner.


Join our Discord server :- https://discord.gg/MTBdkqd
prizes:
For winners we are giving:-

1st placed gets 12 months Pentesterlabs lab access

2nd and 3rd placed gets 6 moths  Pentesterlabs lab access

4th and 5th  placed gets 3 moths  Pentesterlabs lab access

title: Moroccan Cyber Security Camp 2020
description: Moroccan Cyber Security Camp (MCSC) is an annual event full of various activities like conferences and the workshops guided by professional people and experts in the cuber security field . The CTF lasts a whole night and has a friendly aspect. Participants divided to groups of three, work together on various tests of growing difficulty to discover the flaws and vulnerabilities in an IT system which is developed for this special occasion, then come up with a program that will eventually close those security breaches, correct these weaknesses and make the system stronger and safe from any other threats. The challenge covers every corner of the information security field: application vulnerabilities, network and Web weaknesses, physical vulnerabilities, flaws in systems, etc. In the end, an intelligent and smart system will count each team’s score, and winners will eventually get remarkable prizes.

title: TG:HACK 2020
description:
NOTE! This event is _only_ online this year.

NOTE! You can start solve beginner challenges 2 months before the main competitions starts. 

NOTE! The main competition starts at 18.00 UTC+2 (NOT BST!!) the 8th of April. 

TG:HACK is a beginner friendly jeopardy style CTF. It is both onsite and online, as well as a wargame. Our main focus is making guiding tasks for beginners, but we also make challenging tasks for the experienced ones. We will upload an highscore list to CTFtime within the time limit this time!

We have a pre-contest for beginners, starting in February. The main competition starts 8th of April, 18.00 (UTC+2), and ends 11th of April 18.00. 

The rest of the year, the tasks are open as a wargame. You may log in and solve tasks all year to improve your CTF skills!

Writeups will be published at https://github.com/tghack shortly after the competition has ended.

We also want to thank Google for sponsoring our hosting. Google is looking for security engineers in all regions. Read more at https://careers.google.com/.
prizes:
So, it turns we have prizes after all!! Many thanks to our prize sponsor NTNU!! :honk: 

1. place: 13.000 NOK + 5 tickets for The Gathering 2021!
2. place: 7.500 NOK
3. place: 5.000 NOK

title: CSR Germany Quals
description:
**!!! DUE TO CORONA WE HAVE TO MOVE THE EVENT. IT WILL TAKE PLACE 2020-10-30 till 2020-11-01.!!!**
Sorry for the inconvenience. We asked the admins to move the event accordingly...

RedRocket, Gleitkommafreunde Bonn and NVISO are organizing this years CyberSecRumble Germany.

The CSR will have a 48h qualification round and a 8h + 24h on-site final (during a 3 day event) in Bonn. The final will take place 26.06. - 28.06..
Everybody is allowed to participate online.
However, only German university students (Bsc, Msc or PhD) can qualify for the finals.
The trips to the finals are paid and organized by us.

We'll have tasks in all categories: pwn, rev, crypto, web, ... and of course A LOT of guessing and stego ;)!
A team is allowed to have up to 6 hackers (also in the quals).
prizes:
Top 16 German university teams will be invited to the finals.

Prizes in the finals will be o.a.:

- Fully Paid Trip for the whole team to DEFCON 2020
- SANS trainings for the whole team
- Many more

Again we'll have a prize pool of around 80k Euros.
Exact prizes will be announced later.
Unfortunately only German university students are eligible for prizes.

title: NorthSec 2020
description:
Our applied security contest (also called CTF as in "Capture The Flag") is the world's biggest on-site: it opposes 120 teams of 20 people trying to obtain the most points by capturing flags.

Those flags typically are secret messages hidden in different challenges.

The Challenges will be available to teams through a web portal on their own private contest network, they are not authorized to attack each other (it's not a red/blue team type of contest), they compete to have the most points on the leaderboard.

Challenges also include physical aspect of security: lockpicking, key impressionning, social engineering, hardware/soldering challenges.

description:
THE DATES ABOVE ARE WRONG. CHECK THE WEBSITE FOR CORRECT START AND END TIMES. 

TJCTF is a Capture the Flag (CTF) competition hosted by TJHSST's Computer Security Club. It is an online, jeopardy-style competition targeted at high schoolers interested in Computer Science and Cybersecurity. Participants may compete on a team of up to 5 people, and will solve problems in categories such as Binary Exploitation, Reverse Engineering, Web Exploitation, Forensics, and Cryptography in order to gain points. The eligible teams with the most points will win prizes at the end of the competition. Anyone is allowed to compete, but only high school teams in the United States are eligible for prizes.

description:
Brazilian Thematic CTF, organized by ELT members. Jeopardy, more multidisciplinary than usual and with many *unique* challenges in all categories. Brace yourselves!

Registration: https://pwn2.win/

Read carefully how the competition will work: https://pwn2.win/NIZKCTF-js/rules

If you want to learn more about our Non-Interactive Zero-Knowledge (NIZK) platform, read this paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1708.05844.pdf

If you want to help us promoting the event, see the illustration of this year's story: https://bit.ly/Illustration-Pwn2Win-2020

May 29 (friday), to be started at 13:37 BRT (UTC -3), for 48 hours straight.

Twitter: @eltctfbr and @pwn2win
IRC: #pwn2win@freenode

Infra sponsored by g.co/cloud
prizes:

title: Geekpwn x Tencent YDLAB Cloud Range Challenge 2020 Quals
description:
After the first Cloud Security Challenge, GeekPwn and Tencent Security YunDing Lab will hold the second Cloud Security Challenge Quals in July, 2020. The competition includes two parts: "Cloud Range Challenge" and "Cloud Security Open Challenge", which are closer to the actual cloud environment.
The "Cloud Range Challenge" is divided into two stages: a jeopardy-style online quals and an offline finals.  In order to encourage players to study the security of cloud computing facilities and improve the security of cloud computing, this year's competition has set up the "Cloud Security Open Challenge" which provides the typical cloud computing facilities for players to hack.

description:

As a bonus, the greatest team will be awarded a prize with $$$ thanks to Flatt Security Inc. Don’t miss it!

Thanks to our partner Flatt SECURITY!
