title: Black Cell SecOps 2024 - Online Blue Teaming Jeopardy CTF
description:
Our event will feature an online Jeopardy-style contest where participants can test their cybersecurity skills and compete for prizes. The CTF will be hosted in a Microsoft Azure cloud environment, where participants’ forensic investigation skills and Microsoft Sentinel knowledge will be put to the test. Participants will be provided a disk image containing forensics tools and data exports (PCAPs, memory images, disk images, etc.) collected from compromised infrastructure. Additionally, participants will be provided access to a Microsoft Sentinel instance that also contains a variety of logs from the compromised infrastructure. Using these tools and data sources contestants will need to find flags and build a timeline of the attackers’ actions…

Scenario
ACME is a small company with 5-10 employees working in the financial services sector. They operate a hybrid infrastructure with some resources in the cloud and some on-premises. Notably cybersecurity was never a high priority at the company, and they do not follow any on-premises or cloud security frameworks. A few weeks ago, they had suffered a ransomware attack which left their infrastructure in shambles. The IT person at the company has attempted to investigate the root cause of the attack but has found themselves in over their head. The IT person has provided you with a few data files that they had collected during their failed investigation (VM images, PCAPs, memory images, etc.) and has also given you access to their security tools. Using these tools build a timeline of the attacker’s actions and identify the traces they have left behind.

Registration: https://blackcell.io/ctf/
prizes:
The first 5 highest scoring team will be glorified in our CTF Hall of Fame, shared with all our customers. 

Additionally: 
1st place: a handcrafted CTF plaquette + online Golden badge
2. Online Silver badge
3. Online Bronze badge

title: HTB Business CTF 2024: The Vault Of Hope
description:
In the aftermath of a devastating nuclear fallout, society’s remnants struggle amid desolation. Guided by a visionary leader, a determined group sets forth on a perilous quest to secure humanity’s future. Their target: a hidden underground vault, rumored to cradle the gold reserves of a long-forgotten nation. With promises of a new currency and societal rebirth, the team journeys through peril, each step fraught with danger.

As daylight flickers in the wasteland, our survivors embark on gathering crucial intelligence. Through scavengers and informants, they infiltrate abandoned nuclear facilities, unveiling blueprints and schematics that decrypt the vault’s mysteries.

Armed with this knowledge, the team maneuvers through the intricate dance of defying the vault’s formidable defenses. Skilled hackers exploit vulnerabilities, disabling sensors and outsmarting turrets. Resourceful engineers craft makeshift devices, disrupting surveillance and silencing communication frequencies, ensuring stealth amidst chaos.

Unlock the secrets within, heralding a new era. The Vault awaits, and your journey into the unknown begins.

title: AVSS Contest Final 2024
description:
GEEKCON are thrilled to host the 2024 AVSS (Adversarial Vulnerability Scoring System) Contest.

Unlike traditional CTF events, the AVSS Contest can be viewed as a "collision test field" for information systems based on the real adversarial network environment.

The 2024 AVSS Contest is focused on mobile and vehicle security. It consists of two stages:  an online qualifier and an onsite final. Contestants will compete in a Jeopardy-style format using the competition platform provided by the organizer.The online qualifier will be based on simulated environments and remote real-world device environments, while the onsite final will mainly focus on real-world device environments.

The competition will feature a variety of challenges related to mobile devices, cars, and information systems. This competition will specifically evaluate the participants' ability to exploit the same vulnerability or similar vulnerabilities in different system environments.

The organizers have intentionally embedded identical or similar vulnerabilities in different versions of the software system and will provide the vulnerability information to the contestants. Contestants will need to exploit the pre-set vulnerabilities to obtain flags.

The onlinequalifier ise scheduled to take place on April 20, 2024, at 10:00 AM (UTC+8) and end at  April 22, 2023, at 10:00 AM(UTC+8), which will last for 48 hours.

The 2024 AVSS Contest provides challenges for cybersecurity enthusiasts of all levels. Beginners can get their feet wet with our introductory events, while experts can test their skills against our advanced scenarios. Our range of difficulty ensures an engaging experience for participants at any point in their cybersecurity journey.

This contest is the perfect opportunity to develop new skills, pursue your cybersecurity passions, and connect with others in the community. Mark your calendars and get ready for an immersive cybersecurity challenge like no other. Whether you're new to CTFs or a seasoned pro, the AVSS contest has something exciting in store for you.


Discord: https://discord.gg/dWvBrfwAmF
Registration: https://avss.geekcon.top/
E-mail: avss_contest@geekcon.top
prizes:
The award ceremony for the on-site competition teams will be held at the GEEKCON 2024 International based on the final results.

1st Place Prize: $3,000 USD
2nd Place Prize: $1,500 USD
3rd Place Prize: $1,000 USD
4th and 5th Place Prize: $500 USD

GEEKCON will cover travel and accommodation expenses for on-site competition teams to and from Singapore.

title: Codegate CTF 2024 Preliminary
description:
1. CODEGATE 2024 CTF has two divisions: Junior and General.
2. Conditions of participation for each division:
   - Junior Division: Individual competition, only for those born in 2006 or later.
   - General Division: Team competition, for everyone else not in the Junior Division. Participants eligible for the Junior Division may also compete in the General Division, but they cannot participate in both divisions simultaneously.
3. Challenges in the Junior Division may differ from those in the General Division, although there may be some common challenges.
4. General Division team member limits:
   - Preliminary Round: No limit on the number of team members (10 or less recommended).
   - Final Round: Maximum of 4 members. The team captain has the authority to decide the team members for the final round. Remote participation is not allowed; all members must be physically present.
   
5. Official communication channel: Discord (We will communicate any updates during the competition via Discord).
6. Questions about challenges should be asked by opening a ticket on Discord.
7. Actions that may result in disqualification:
   - Sharing or seeking clues, hints, flags, or answers with participants outside of your team.
   - Participating in multiple teams.
   - Interfering with, obstructing, or disrupting other teams, participants, or organizers (including, but not limited to, DoS and DDoS attacks).
   - Attacking or spying on other teams, participants, or organizers.
   - Brute-forcing flags on the *.codegate.org flag authentication system.
   - Intentionally hindering others from submitting or obtaining flags.
   - Participating in divisions not allowed by the rules (e.g., participating in the Junior Division if born before 2005, or participating in both the Junior and General Divisions simultaneously).
   - Attacking machines or infrastructure not designated as challenges in the competition.
   - Failing to provide a reasonable explanation for suspected cheating.
8. Write-up submission:
   - General Division: Top 25 teams must submit write-ups within 24 hours of the preliminary round ending.
   - Junior Division: Top 25 participants must submit write-ups within 24 hours of the preliminary round ending.
   - Write-ups should be submitted to codegateqna@gmail.com.
9. Finalist teams announcement:
   -  Finalists will be officially announced after organizers have reviewed the top teams' write-ups.
   - The scoreboard cannot be used to confirm finalist teams, even after the preliminary round ends.
   - Number of finalist teams:
     - General Division: 20 teams (19 from the preliminary round, 1 from the winner of CODEGATE 2023 CTF Finals General Division).
     - Junior Division: Top 20 participants from the preliminary round.
   - User accounts created during preliminary registration must belong to the participant. Identification is required for the final round.
   
   
Disclaimer: We organizers will do our best to enforce these rules. However, if a situation arises that cannot be reasonably resolved, We will hold an internal meeting to discuss the issue and communicate the decision to the affected participants.

title: DASCTF X HDCTF 2024 Open Competition
description:
The DASCTF X HDCTF 2024 Open Competition is hosted by the BUUCTF platform in collaboration with the Hnusec team from Hainan University. This competition aims to provide a platform for cybersecurity enthusiasts worldwide to showcase their skills and exchange experiences. The competition will cover various categories, including Web, MISC, Crypto, Reverse, and Pwn, challenging participants' comprehensive abilities.

**Competition Mode**
Team Competition (four people per team)

**Special Reminders**
- This competition uses dynamic scoring. Each problem starts with 1000 points, decreasing to a minimum of 200 points after 67 solves. The organizers reserve the right to modify the scoring rules.
- Each team can have up to four dynamic targets open simultaneously. The organizers reserve the right to modify this rule.
- After the competition, teams wishing to receive points must submit their write-ups by noon (12:00 PM) Beijing time on June 3, 2024. The submission should be uploaded to the platform (Personal Information - Write-up Information Box, where a submission area will appear). The team leader or any team member can upload it, but only one complete PDF per team will be accepted.

**Registration Method**
1. Log in to the BUUCTF platform
2. Enter the Competition Center
3. Select the corresponding competition
4. Fill in personal information
5. Create a team TOKEN
6. Share the team TOKEN with team members

title: Crypto CTF 2024
description:
Crypto CTF is an online competition for hackers to test, evaluate, and expand their skills in exploiting cryptography. In this CTF, we will provide various crypto challenges that focus on modern cryptography techniques.
All crypto lovers are most welcome!
Crypto CTF is a response to the longstanding complaints by CTF participants about the crypto challenges in CTF contests. In this brand-new tournament, we aim to provide crypto enthusiasts with fun and challenging pure crypto tasks that will truly test their passion for cryptography.
Each task will be based on a specific cryptographic primitive or will involve a direct application of cryptography in other fields.
The organizers of these tournaments generously offer their knowledge and skills to design original Crypto tasks and challenges for similar contests.
Long Live Crypto :)

Discord: https://discord.gg/RsvAJtF5Q5

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Crypto_CTF
prizes: .:: To be announced ::.

title: CyberSci Nationals 2024
description:
CyberSci is Canada's national Cyber Security Challenge for university and college students.
- Think you've got an elite team of students? Come and prove it. Our winners will go on to compete against the best in the world.
- Just starting out? This is the best way to learn and rise to the top.
- Annual in-person events since 2016. Over 500 students so far.

We run the Canadian national finals in Ottawa in the summer.
- The winning team from each CyberSci regional event is invited to attend the national finals.
- An all-women’s team, an all-juniors team, and an all-Indigenous team are also invited.
- The 4-day on-site event has a Jeopardy and a Defense competition.
- Top teams from the nationals go on to represent Canada at international events.
prizes: National winners will represent Canada at international events in 2024.

title: Break The Wall - Dystopia 2099
description:
Year 2099. The world has succumbed to a digital dystopia. A conglomerate of mega-corporations known as The Consortium rules with an iron fist, controlling every aspect of life through a global network of surveillance and censorship known as The Wall. Information is power, and The Consortium jealously hoards it, feeding the population propaganda and keeping the masses ignorant and docile.

In the shadows of this dark world, BreakTheWall emerges, an underground movement of hackers, activists and digital rebels fighting for freedom of information and the restoration of privacy. Their goal: to dismantle The Wall and return power to humanity.

Players must prove their worth through a series of clandestine missions that will test their offensive security skills.

The road to freedom is paved with The Wall's surveillance systems and security agents. Players must use their wits, skills and courage to overcome these obstacles and break through The Wall, bringing hope and freedom to oppressed humanity.

Find more information here: https://breakthewall.hackrocks.com/info/about

1st - 2000€
2nd - 1000€
3rd - 500€
Terms and conditions available here: https://breakthewall.hackrocks.com/info/about

title: Junior.Crypt.2024 CTF
description:
Junior.Crypt.2024 CTF is an open competition in information security for beginners, students and everyone. This is a 48 hour online event. We hope all participants can use their skills and have a great time.

The organizers of the CTF were students of the Department of System Programming and Computer Security of Grodno State University, Grodno, Belarus.

Team participation. Team of 1-4 people.
The tasks relate to different areas - beginner, cryptography, forensics, miscellaneous, OSINT, ppc, pwn, rev, web. They will be of interest to beginners, students and everyone else.

The official languages of the tournament are English and Russian. But you can take part even if you don't speak any of them. We will do our best to ensure that each condition of the problem can be understood with the correct use of machine translation. In addition, during the tournament tasks, we will try to introduce our participants to an unusually beautiful country, our Republic of Belarus.
prizes: Unfortunately, we do not have a huge prize fund. Participants from Belarus will receive prizes from IT companies. We promise everyone professional respect, pride and satisfaction from solving interesting problems and knowledge in the field of cybersecurity.

title: DownUnderCTF 2024
description: DownUnderCTF is the largest online Australian-run Capture The Flag (CTF) competition, now welcoming Aotearoa (New Zealand) to the competition for the first time in 2024. With over 4200+ registered users and more than 2000+ registered teams as of 2023, its primary goal is to up-skill the next generation of potential Cyber Security Professionals and to expand the CTF community in Australia and Aotearoa (New Zealand). While our CTF is an online event open to participants worldwide, starting from 2024, prize eligibility extends to include both Australian and Aotearoa (New Zealand) Secondary or Tertiary school students. This change aims to foster a closer collaboration and competition spirit between the two nations while maintaining our commitment to enhancing cybersecurity skills among the youth.
prizes: https://duc.tf/prizes

title: Interlogica CTF2024 - Wastelands
description:
Welcome to wastelands, where the faint echoes of civilization cling to the sands like whispers of a bygone era. Abandoned technology and rusting drones dot the barren landscape, serving as eerie reminders of humanity's downfall. Amidst the desolation, the remnants of once-thriving sustainability systems cling desperately to survival, struggling to eke out existence amidst the chaos.

Prepare to confront the harsh realities of this unforgiving terrain as you embark on thrilling challenges that will push you to your limits: Reviving Relics, Hydrophonic Systems, Unlocking the Vault, Digital Infiltration, Satellite Takeover, Expeditions, Vehicle Restoration are some of the challenges that await you!

Embark on this epic odyssey and prove your mettle in a world where survival demands more than just strength of arms—it demands cunning, resilience, and the indomitable will to endure. Join us in the ultimate test of endurance and strategy amidst the ruins of civilization. Will you rise to the challenge, or be swallowed by the sands of time?

Event Start:  2024 July 5 13:37 CET
Event End: 2024 July 7 23:59 CET

Maximum Team size: 5 members


Rulez:

1. During brute-force attacks on services and/or web pages, the use of the specified wordlists is mandatory.

2. Actions that overload the resources of competition services, such as saturating disk space or CPU, are prohibited. These activities will be constantly monitored.

3. Exchange of flags and/or solutions between different teams is strictly prohibited. Publishing of walkthroughs or flags before the end of the event is prohibited. Once the event has ended, publishing is encouraged.

4. Performing attacks on infrastructures other than those specified by the challenges is prohibited.

5. The use of multiple environments and different types of automatic encoding presupposes that the participant is able to handle them independently. In case of uncertainty, it is recommended to use a Kali/Parrot virtual machine.

6. Each violation will result in a loss of points for the entire team.

7. The team that first solves a specific challenge will receive additional points (first blood).

8. The top 3 ranked teams will be awarded.

9. Registrations will open one month before the event.

10. Teams can consist of up to a maximum of 5 participants.

11. If an individual does not have a team, a dedicated section for team formation will be available on Discord.

12. Each team will be provided with a dedicated WireGuard VPN to tackle some challenges.

13. A maximum number of 70 teams can participate in the event.

14. A maximum of 3 instances can be executed simultaneously by each team.

15. The portal is integrated with our Discord server, each team will be granted private text and voice channels.

Partecipate to our demo chall while waiting for the main event! https://ctfdemo.interlogica.ninja/ 

If the max number of teams is reached try finding new friends and join other teams in our discord! https://discord.com/invite/DMKdECJn4y

Main Sponsor:
DataFlow Security (https://dfsec.com/)

Platinum Sponsors:
4ISP (https://www.4isp.it/)
DV Cyber Security (https://www.dvcybersecurity.it/)

Gold Sponsor:
KarryCar (https://karrycar.it/)

Silver Sponsor:
Result Consulting (https://www.resultconsulting.it/)
prizes:
Money and swag for the first 3 teams. 

Winner team: 3000€+swag
Second place: 1000€+swag
Third place: swag 

Note: Prize may vary depending on the winning team origin country because of different tax regulations

Join our discord for updates: 
https://discord.com/invite/DMKdECJn4y

title: CatTheQuest
description:
Prepare yourself for CatTheQuest 2024: Registrations Are Now Open!

Dear CTF enthusiasts,

We are thrilled to announce the opening of registrations for the very first edition of CatTheQuest, our highly anticipated Capture the Flag (CTF) competition, taking place from July 15th to July 21st, 2024, online at https://catthequest.com!

CatTheQuest: A Virtual Odyssey

Whether you're a seasoned veteran or a curious novice, CatTheQuest is the perfect event to test your skills, collaborate with experts, and solve security puzzles.

An Enriching Experience

Tiered Systems: Tailored for all levels, our challenges allow everyone to progress at their own pace, whether you're a beginner or an expert.
Exciting Innovations: Expect numerous surprises that will make every step of this adventure even more exhilarating.

Register Now!

Don't miss your chance to participate in this unprecedented competition. Join us on the event's website https://catthequest.com to register and stay updated with the latest news. Connect with fellow enthusiasts, exchange tips, and prepare together to dominate the world of CatTheQuest.

Join Our Community

Follow us on social media to stay updated on announcements, tips, and direct interactions with organizers and other participants. Your engagement and community spirit drive our success, and we look forward to seeing you shine in this competition.

We are eager to welcome you and celebrate this extraordinary journey together.

See you soon at CatTheQuest!

With enthusiasm,
The CatTheFlag Team

title: DASCTF 2024 Summer Challenge
description: The DASCTF 2024 Summer Challenge is hosted by the BUUCTF platform. The challenges for this competition are provided by Zhejiang Police College, Jiangxi Police College, and Shandong Police College. This competition aims to provide a platform for cybersecurity enthusiasts worldwide to showcase their skills and exchange experiences. The competition will cover various categories, including Web, MISC, Crypto, Reverse, and Pwn, challenging participants' comprehensive abilities. **Competition Mode** Team Competition (four people per team) **Special Reminders** - This competition uses dynamic scoring. Each problem starts with 1000 points, decreasing to a minimum of 200 points after 67 solves. The organizers reserve the right to modify the scoring rules. - Each team can have up to four dynamic targets open simultaneously. The organizers reserve the right to modify this rule. - After the competition, teams wishing to receive points must submit their write-ups by noon (12:00 PM) Beijing time on July 21, 2024. The submission should be uploaded to the platform (Personal Information - Write-up Information Box, where a submission area will appear). The team leader or any team member can upload it, but only one complete PDF per team will be accepted. - Write-up template download: https://files.buuoj.cn/files/2c46921cf2d628130b67f3648fe24934/writeup_template.md - If multiple write-ups are submitted by a team, the last one received by the platform will be considered. - Scores will be synchronized to CTFTime. Teams wishing to receive points should ensure their team name is consistent. Thank you. **Registration Method** 1. Log in to the BUUCTF platform 2. Enter the Competition Center 3. Select the corresponding competition 4. Fill in personal information 5. Create a team TOKEN 6. Share the team TOKEN with team members

title: BDSec CTF 2024
description:
Announcement: Cancellation of BDSec CTF 2024
Dear Participants,

We regret to inform you that due to unforeseen circumstances, the BDSec CTF 2024 has been canceled.

On July 18, 2024, a significant disruption occurred in Bangladesh's broadband infrastructure. This was caused by the destruction of critical cables at the Khaza Tower, a central hub for broadband services, during recent quota movement protests. The subsequent government decision to shut down mobile internet services further compounded the issue, leaving us without connectivity and unable to proceed with our planned event.

We understand the disappointment this news brings, especially after all the preparation and anticipation for the CTF. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and any disruption this may have caused to your plans. As organizers, we are deeply committed to providing a platform for cybersecurity enthusiasts, and it is with a heavy heart that we had to make this decision.

We are grateful for your understanding and support during this challenging time. Rest assured, we are already planning for BDSec CTF 2025 and are determined to make it an exceptional experience for all participants.

Thank you for your patience and continued support. We look forward to welcoming you next year for a bigger and better BDSec CTF.

Sincerely,

The BDSec CTF Organizing Team

title: SCAN 2024 Digital Asset Tracing Challenge
description:
The SCAN 2024 Digital Asset Tracing Challenge is the world's first competition to determine which team possesses the most advanced skillset in digital asset tracing and other critical capabilities necessary for keeping the digital economy secure.
The questions included in the CTF are designed to evaluate your knowledge and skills related to unraveling the inner workings of the Virtual Asset ecosystem.
This includes, but is not limited to, UTXO chains (Bitcoin), EVM chains (Ethereum, Tron), and essential investigation skills such as cryptographic functions, transaction tracking, reverse engineering, and programming.
We are proud to host SCAN 2024 thanks to the generous support of Upbit, one of the world's biggest crypto exchanges operated by Dunamu, Korea Institute of Information Security and Cryptography(KIISC), National Security Research Institute, Digital Asset Exchange Allicance(DAXA), Bonanza Factory and Blockchain Intelligence Group. Their commitment and sponsorship make this event possible, helping to promote transparency and security in the digital asset ecosystem.
prizes: Stand a chance to win exciting prizes worth 2 BTC!!!

We've meticulously engineered the event's website from scratch, ensuring a seamless and enriching user experience. Our diverse set of challenges spans Pwn, Reverse, Web, Crypto, and Misc, each graded from "Warmup" to "Hard".

This deliberate spectrum of difficulty ensures our CTF event is universally accessible - from cybersecurity novices eager to learn the ropes, to seasoned experts looking to flex their skills in a challenging environment. Mark your calendars for a uniquely immersive cybersecurity adventure. The Few Chosen CTF 2024: The perfect platform for honing skills, fueling passions, and embracing the cybersecurity community.

title: DASCTF2024 August Back-to-School Season
description: The DASCTF2024 August Back-to-School Season is hosted by the BUUCTF platform. This competition aims to provide a platform for cybersecurity enthusiasts worldwide to showcase their skills and exchange experiences. The competition will cover various categories, including Web, MISC, Crypto, Reverse, and Pwn, challenging participants' comprehensive abilities. **Competition Mode** Team Competition (four people per team) **Special Reminders** - This competition uses dynamic scoring. Each problem starts with 1000 points, decreasing to a minimum of 200 points after 67 solves. The organizers reserve the right to modify the scoring rules. - Each team can have up to four dynamic targets open simultaneously. The organizers reserve the right to modify this rule. - After the competition, teams wishing to receive points must submit their write-ups by noon (12:00 PM) Beijing time on August 25, 2024. The submission should be uploaded to the platform (Personal Information - Write-up Information Box, where a submission area will appear). The team leader or any team member can upload it, but only one complete PDF per team will be accepted. If you do not need points, you can ignore this rule; it will not affect your ranking. - Write-up template download: https://files.buuoj.cn/files/2c46921cf2d628130b67f3648fe24934/writeup_template.md - If multiple write-ups are submitted by a team, the last one received by the platform will be considered. - Scores will be synchronized to CTFTime. Teams wishing to receive points should ensure their team name is consistent. Thank you. **Competition Time** August 24, 2024, 10:00—18:00 (UTC+8) **Registration Time** August 15, 2024, 10:00—August 24, 2024, 18:00 (UTC+8) **Problem Categories** Web, MISC, Crypto, Reverse, Pwn **Registration Method** 1. Log in to BUU 2. Enter the Competition Center 3. Select the corresponding competition 4. Enter personal information 5. Create a team TOKEN 6. Share the team TOKEN with team members **Awards** First Prize * 1, Second Prize * 2, Third Prize * 3

title: Codegate CTF 2024 Finals
description:
1. CODEGATE 2024 CTF has two divisions: Junior and General.
2. Conditions of participation for each division:
   - Junior Division: Individual competition, only for those born in 2006 or later.
   - General Division: Team competition, for everyone else not in the Junior Division. Participants eligible for the Junior Division may also compete in the General Division, but they cannot participate in both divisions simultaneously.
3. Challenges in the Junior Division may differ from those in the General Division, although there may be some common challenges.
4. General Division team member limits:
   - Preliminary Round: No limit on the number of team members (10 or less recommended).
   - Final Round: Maximum of 4 members. The team captain has the authority to decide the team members for the final round. Remote participation is not allowed; all members must be physically present.
   
5. Official communication channel: Discord (We will communicate any updates during the competition via Discord).
6. Questions about challenges should be asked by opening a ticket on Discord.
7. Actions that may result in disqualification:
   - Sharing or seeking clues, hints, flags, or answers with participants outside of your team.
   - Participating in multiple teams.
   - Interfering with, obstructing, or disrupting other teams, participants, or organizers (including, but not limited to, DoS and DDoS attacks).
   - Attacking or spying on other teams, participants, or organizers.
   - Brute-forcing flags on the *.codegate.org flag authentication system.
   - Intentionally hindering others from submitting or obtaining flags.
   - Participating in divisions not allowed by the rules (e.g., participating in the Junior Division if born before 2005, or participating in both the Junior and General Divisions simultaneously).
   - Attacking machines or infrastructure not designated as challenges in the competition.
   - Failing to provide a reasonable explanation for suspected cheating.
8. Write-up submission:
   - General Division: Top 25 teams must submit write-ups within 24 hours of the preliminary round ending.
   - Junior Division: Top 25 participants must submit write-ups within 24 hours of the preliminary round ending.
   - Write-ups should be submitted to codegateqna@gmail.com.
9. Finalist teams announcement:
   -  Finalists will be officially announced after organizers have reviewed the top teams' write-ups.
   - The scoreboard cannot be used to confirm finalist teams, even after the preliminary round ends.
   - Number of finalist teams:
     - General Division: 20 teams (19 from the preliminary round, 1 from the winner of CODEGATE 2023 CTF Finals General Division).
     - Junior Division: Top 20 participants from the preliminary round.
   - User accounts created during preliminary registration must belong to the participant. Identification is required for the final round.
   
   
Disclaimer: We organizers will do our best to enforce these rules. However, if a situation arises that cannot be reasonably resolved, We will hold an internal meeting to discuss the issue and communicate the decision to the affected participants.

title: CISA ICS CTF 2024
description: Overview CISA’s annual Capture the Flag (CTF) is oriented around an incident response scenario involving attacks on critical infrastructure. This year, the featured critical infrastructure sectors are city infrastructure, water purification, medical facilities, and railway. The CTF is open from Saturday, August 31 at 1:00 p.m. EDT through Wednesday, September 4 at 12:00 p.m. EDT. Challenges are presented jeopardy-style, with a wide range of difficulty and a set of introductory challenges, and teams may contain up to four players. This CTF runs alongside the Mal.Con ’24 conference, but meeting attendance is not required to participate. Registration opens Saturday, August 24 at 1:00 p.m. EDT and remains open until the end of the competition, so players can join at any point. Registration will be located at https://ctf.cisaicsctf.com/. Scenario In this Capture the Flag event, you will be serving the role as an incident responder investigating various cyber incidents that occurred in the small city of Driftveil. This CTF is split into five main categories: • Security Foundations: introduction challenges that provide an introduction to Malcolm and an overview of basic ICS and security concepts • Driftveil City: Driftveil City is a small city on the coast and has been experiencing issues with their city infrastructure ICS protocols • Castelia Solutions: Castelia Solutions is the primary water-treatment facility for Driftveil and have been experiencing issues with their Historian and various embedded devices • Virbank Medical: Virbank Medical is the main hospital serving Driftveil and its surrounding towns and has been experiencing issues due to ransomware and poor cyber hygiene • Anville Railway: Anville Railway is a large rail-transport operating company headquartered in Driftveil and has been experiencing issues with their ICS network and devices When solving challenges for these organizations, you and your team will be working alongside and assisting their engineers, technicians, IT, and security teams to investigate and remediate their cyber incidents. Each organization will have an introductory challenge to brief you on their situation and what they need your team's help with. The Security Foundations challenges serve as introductory-level challenges on various security and ICS concepts and are unrelated to the scenario. Each company has provided network traffic to assist you in your investigation. All network traffic was taken on Thursday, June 20 2024 and has been ingested into Driftveil's security operations center's (SOC) Malcolm instance.

title: BlackHat MEA CTF Qualification 2024
description:
Black Hat MEA in collaboration with Saudi Federation for Cybersecurity, Programming & Drones (SAFCSP) will host a CTF Tournament and powered by FlagYard Platform, with over 1,000 participants (250 teams) entering the final stages at different levels of competency: amateur, intermediate and expert.

CTF competition run as a jeopardy-style competition and team based both in the qualification and final stages. 
Participants will be challenged across a range of categories during the competition including Web, Reverse Engineering, PWN, Crypto and Forensics.

description:
DFIR Labs CTF Details:
Duration: Each CTF lasts 4 hours.
SIEM Options: Choose between Splunk and Elastic for your SIEM tool.
Communication: Join our DFIR Labs CTF Discord Server for support and real-time updates.
Cases: You will receive access to two detailed intrusion cases.
Questions: Complete 20 questions within the 4-hour timeframe.
Access: You’ll receive access to both cases 1 hour before the start of the CTF. All you need is a web browser.
Support: Live support on Discord and via email.

description:
This is the first jailCTF event. Unlike traditional CTFs, this event has a large focus on "jail" challenges which ask players to escape out of a code sandbox with some set of restrictions applied. Categories here aren't traditional here either, with categories such as pyjail, esolang, and mainstream (js, perl, ruby, c, etc). Even if you don't know much about jail challenges, you can still learn and have fun with challenges in the introductory category. Come and have fun in jailCTF!

Sponsored by Zellic!!! https://www.zellic.io/

Note: https://ctf.pyjail.club/ has been taken down for the time being. The challenge handouts and remotes, along with author solutions, are available at https://github.com/jailctf/challenges-2024

title: 21ans LinuxMeetup au Québec
description:
CTF in French ...: celebrating the 21th anniversary of the Linux Meetup in Québec.

Chers étudiants,

LinuXversité est ravie de vous inviter à l'examen unique pour célébrer la fin de l'année universitaire !
Ce concours mettra à l'épreuve vos apprentissages en Linux, en réseaux, et en cryptographie, et vous permettra de démontrer votre capacité à résoudre des défis en équipe.

Les examens approchent, et les étudiants de LinuXversité doivent prouver leur maîtrise des sujets appris tout au long de l'année. Mais cette fois, l'objectif est de trouver des "astuces" #open-source pour obtenir la meilleure note possible.

Compétences nécessaires :
Maîtrise des commandes bash : soyez prêts à utiliser des commandes efficaces pour résoudre des problèmes rapidement.
Connaissances en réseaux : comprenez et manipulez les éléments réseaux pour déjouer les défis.
Notions de cryptographie : déchiffrez des messages et résolvez des énigmes cryptographiques pour avancer dans le jeu.

Détails de l'événement :
    Date : 21 Septembre
    Heure : 12:00 - 17:00
    Lieu :  On Prem et On Linux

Formez vos équipes, révisez bien, et préparez-vous à une compétition intense et enrichissante ! Les meilleures équipes seront récompensées par des prix exclusifs et des certificats de réussite.

Rejoignez-nous pour ce défi passionnant et montrez que vous avez ce qu'il faut pour triompher des examens de LinuXversité avec style !

L'équipe de LinuXversité

Enregistrez vous ici : 
https://www.rencontres-linux.quebec/event/21-ans-de-linux-meetup-au-quebec-1/page/emplacement-21-ans-de-linux-meetup-au-quebec
prizes:
Physical prizes are available only in Quebec, Canada. 
Web-based prizes (Amazon, Google, Apple gift cards) are available for countries outside of Quebec.

Registration is required on :
https://www.rencontres-linux.quebec/event/21-ans-de-linux-meetup-au-quebec-1/page/emplacement-21-ans-de-linux-meetup-au-quebec

title: DefCamp Capture the Flag (D-CTF) 2024 Quals
description:
? Mark Your Calendars! The DefCamp Capture the Flag (D-CTF) Qualification Phase is Locked and Loaded for 2024! ?

logo-big-leftGet ready to dive into the most electrifying and audacious security CTF competition in Central and Eastern Europe—DefCamp Capture The Flag (D-CTF)!

This is where the sharpest hackers and IT masterminds come together to push their skills to the limit, battling it out with top CTF teams from around the globe. The mission? Secure a spot in the elite top 10 and ultimately conquer the D-CTF competition—or go down fighting!

Since 2011, DefCamp Capture the Flag has been the ultimate battleground for over 10,000 players. This annual, multi-stage event is open to all, but remember one crucial rule—hack or be hacked!

Event Highlights
Brace yourselves for an adrenaline-packed adventure with around 10 beginner-friendly challenges and 15 more difficult tasks that will test even the most seasoned players.

Format: Jeopardy

Play Format: Team-only

Genres: Crypto, Pwning, Reversing, Web, Forensics, Miscellaneous…

Language: English

Access: Open / Free for everyone

Difficulty: Entry Level - Easy - Medium - Hard - Insane

Website: D-CTF

The Challenge Awaits
Tackle a variety of challenges across multiple categories.
Exploit system weaknesses, follow cryptic hints, and uncover hidden secrets.
Each challenge holds a unique flag in the format CTF{sha256 random message}. Capture it, submit it on our platform, and rack up your points.
CTF competitions are a thrilling mix of puzzles and challenges, including reverse-engineering, memory corruption, cryptography, web tech, and more. Solve them, capture the flag, and climb the leaderboard to victory!
Organizers & Partners
This epic event is brought to you by the Cyber Security Research Center from Romania (Asociatia Centrul de Cercetare in Securitate Informatica din Romania) under the banner of DefCamp, Romania's largest and most vibrant INFOSEC community.
prizes:
Best international teams in the global ranking and top teams from Romania are invited to the grand finale of DefCamp 2024, one of the largest and most anticipated cybersecurity conferences in the region.

The event will take place from November 28th-29th in Bucharest, Romania.

The final showdown will feature an intense 1-day Attack-Defence exercise, and maybe even a sprinkle of Jeopardy! ?

Qualification
Up to 15 teams will be invited to compete for glory in Bucharest, Romania, at the D-CTF 2024 Final.
Up to 3 teams from Romania will also secure a spot in the final
Finalists will receive free tickets to DefCamp 2024.
Full or partial accommodation reimbursement will be provided.
Main Prizes - International (for the final, onsite):
1st place: €1,536
2nd place: €1,024
3rd place: €512
Best Team from Romania: €512
Other Prizes (online and onsite):
Best Write-up (1 prize each for online and onsite): €512, available only to the top 30 teams.

title: SCAN 2024 Digital Asset Tracing Challenge Second Round
description:
The SCAN 2024 Digital Asset Tracing Challenge is the world's first competition to determine which team possesses the most advanced skillset in digital asset tracing and other critical capabilities necessary for keeping the digital economy secure.
The questions included in the CTF are designed to evaluate your knowledge and skills related to unraveling the inner workings of the Virtual Asset ecosystem.
This includes, but is not limited to, UTXO chains (Bitcoin), EVM chains (Ethereum, Tron), and essential investigation skills such as cryptographic functions, transaction tracking, reverse engineering, and programming.
We are proud to host SCAN 2024 thanks to the generous support of Upbit, one of the world's biggest crypto exchanges operated by Dunamu, Korea Institute of Information Security and Cryptography(KIISC), National Security Research Institute, Digital Asset Exchange Allicance(DAXA), Bonanza Factory and Blockchain Intelligence Group. Their commitment and sponsorship make this event possible, helping to promote transparency and security in the digital asset ecosystem.

The Second Preliminary Round on October 19 is open to everyone, regardless of participation in the First Preliminary Round. Teams that placed in the top 8 in the First Round are guaranteed a spot in the finals but are still welcome to join the Second Preliminary Round if they wish.

The 8 teams with the highest scores from this round, along with the 8 teams already selected from the First Preliminary Round, will compete in the finals for a total prize pool of 2 BTC. Prizes will be awarded from 1st place (1 BTC) to 8th place (0.05 BTC). The SCAN 2024 finals will take place on Friday, November 22, at 10:00 AM KST (Korean Standard Time) in Seoul, South Korea.

For more details: https://scan.sx/
prizes: Stand a chance to win exciting prizes worth 2 BTC!

title: DASCTF 2024 Golden October | Autumn is Strong, the Flames of War
description: The DASCTF 2024 Golden October is hosted by the BUUCTF platform. This competition aims to provide a platform for cybersecurity enthusiasts worldwide to showcase their skills and exchange experiences. The competition will cover various categories, including Web, MISC, Crypto, Reverse, and Pwn, challenging participants' comprehensive abilities. **Competition Mode** Team Competition (four people per team) **Special Reminders** - This competition uses dynamic scoring. Each problem starts with 1000 points, decreasing to a minimum of 200 points after 67 solves. The organizers reserve the right to modify the scoring rules. - Each team can have up to four dynamic targets open simultaneously. The organizers reserve the right to modify this rule. - After the competition, teams wishing to receive points must submit their write-ups by noon (12:00 PM) Beijing time on October 20, 2024. The submission should be uploaded to the platform (Personal Information - Write-up Information Box, where a submission area will appear). The team leader or any team member can upload it, but only one complete PDF per team will be accepted. If you do not need points, you can ignore this rule; it will not affect your ranking. - Write-up template download: https://files.buuoj.cn/files/2c46921cf2d628130b67f3648fe24934/writeup_template.md - If multiple write-ups are submitted by a team, the last one received by the platform will be considered. - Scores will be synchronized to CTFTime. Teams wishing to receive points should ensure their team name is consistent. Thank you. **Competition Time** October 19, 2024, 10:00—18:00 (UTC+8) **Registration Time** October 11, 2024, 10:00—October 19, 2024, 18:00 (UTC+8) **Problem Categories** Web, MISC, Crypto, Reverse, Pwn **Registration Method** 1. Log in to BUU 2. Enter the Competition Center 3. Select the corresponding competition 4. Enter personal information 5. Create a team TOKEN 6. Share the team TOKEN with team members **Awards** First Prize * 1, Second Prize * 2, Third Prize * 3

title: Singapore AI CTF
description:
Join Singapore's first AI Security focused CTF featuring machine learning security challenges in 7 domains!

Register now: go.gov.sg/singaporeaictf
Event website: go.gov.sg/sgaictf

Start Time: Saturday, 26th October 8am (UTC+08 Singapore Time)

End Time: Monday, 28th October 8am (UTC+08 Singapore Time)

The categories of the AI CTF Competition are:

1) Data Analysis
Participants need to utilise various data analysis and visualisation tools to extract hidden information within a given dataset.

2) Model Extraction
Participants use malicious means to extract information from the model (e.g. parameters, architecture, or training data)

3) Model Fingerprinting
Participants must verify watermarks and/or fingerprints in AI models to verify their authenticity and detect unauthorised copies.

4) Prompt Injection
An attack where hackers use a specially crafted input to trick AI into disclosing a hidden secret.

5) Adversarial AI Image
An attacker injects malicious data into the training set causing AI to misclassify an image.

6) Adversarial Audio Generation
Involves replicating voices and audio using AI.

7) Model Inversion
An attacker aims to infer/reconstruct input data based on model outputs.
prizes:
Category 1: Open (Open to all)

1st prize | SGD 10,000

2nd prize | SGD 6,000

3rd prize | SGD 3,000

Category 2: Pre-U (Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents currently studying in a Pre-University Education Institution based in Singapore: Polytechnic, Junior College, Integrated Programme, and Institutes of Technical Education

title: The Cyber Jawara International 2024
description:
After being previously postponed, the competition is now open to international participants, with the SKSD CTF team appointed as the problem setter!

Cyber Jawara, which translates to "Cyber Champion" in Indonesian, is originally an annual cybersecurity hacking competition that began in 2012, organized by ID-SIRTII/CC (Indonesia Security Incident Response Team on Internet Infrastructure/Coordination Center). Since 2020, the competition has been organized by CSIRT.ID (Cyber Security Independent Resilient Team of Indonesia). The event aims to foster interest, talent, and the development of human resources in cybersecurity across Indonesia.

In 2024, a new competition segment is introduced, allowing international participants to join and compete together

This Jeopardy-style CTF will challenge your skills in Web, Crypto, Reverse Engineering, Binary Exploitation, and more! We offer something for players of all levels, from beginners to advanced.

The Pacific Hackers CTF is a highlight of the event, featuring hands-on challenges for all interests and experience levels. You'll be breaking websites, manipulating AI, cracking secret codes and messing with live hardware! Join us at 855 W Maude Ave, Mountain View, CA to play, and make some friends while you're at it!
The CTF will be live on Nov 2nd from 10:00am to 6:00pm PST. Visit https://pacifichackers.com to play!

The event encompasses mind boggling levels, a completely revamped format each year and exciting cash prizes over ₹50,000 ($600)!

title: Die Abenteuer von KIM & TIM Kapt. II - To TI-Mfinity and Beyond
description:
Das 4. TI Capture the Flag Event der gematik am 15.11.2024.

KIM & TIM haben es geschafft – die Fax Flut wurde im Kapt. I gestoppt! Nach dieser Mission (K)IMpossible
bleibt nur noch zu klären, wer dahinter steckt… Let's go to TI-Mfinity and Beyond – wer weiß, was uns diesmal erwartet. Nur eines ist sicher: Mit KIM & TIM werdet Ihr Licht ins Dunkel bringen und den Verantwortlichen für die Fax-
Flut finden…!

Mit dem TI-M(essenger) können alle Gesundheitsberufe deutschlandweit in Echtzeit miteinander kommunizieren. Medizinisch Informationen können mit dem TI-Messenger so schnell und unkompliziert ausgetauscht werden wie bei WhatsApp und Co.

Beim TI Capture The Flag (Jeopardy Style) können im Team mit bis zu 4 Leuten Flags gesammelt werden.

Auf die Gewinner des Contests warten attraktive Preise. Und sicher ist: Alle Teilnehmenden können sich auf einen spannenden und fordernden Wettbewerb in einer virtuellen Welt mit weiteren Challenges freuen. 

Anmeldung bis 12.11.2024 / 23:59 Uhr möglich

title: No Hack No CTF 2024
description:
Welcome to No Hack No CTF 2024, organized by ICEDTEA, a passionate cybersecurity team dedicated to fostering learning and competition among cybersecurity enthusiasts worldwide. This event offers an exciting opportunity for participants to challenge themselves in a fair and competitive environment.

The competition is divided into two categories:

Open Division: Open to participants of any nationality or background. Team participation is encouraged.
Student Division: Exclusively for students currently enrolled in schools in Taiwan. This division focuses on creating a stress-free and inclusive environment for beginners, allowing them to gain experience and confidence in CTF competitions.
Prizes:

Top 3 (Student Division):
1st Place: Discord Nitro
2nd Place: Discord Nitro Basic
3rd Place: Discord Nitro Basic
All participants who complete the competition can apply for an electronic participation certificate to recognize their efforts.

Technical Support and Contact Information:

Technical Support: Join our Discord server for assistance: https://discord.gg/ZXwjmPYYHN
Contact Email: For inquiries, email us at nhnc@ic3dt3a.org
Join us for a thrilling 36-hour event packed with challenges and learning opportunities! Whether you're a seasoned professional or a newcomer to cybersecurity, No Hack No CTF 2024 is the perfect place to test your skills and connect with the global cybersecurity community.

title: Crate-CTF 2024
description:
Crate-CTF is an annual Capture The Flag (CTF) competition organised by the Swedish Defence Research Agency in collaboration with the Swedish Armed Forces, designed to introduce high school and university students to the field of cybersecurity. After having 600 participants last year we return for our fifth CTF, with challenges for all skill levels from beginners to seasoned CTF players. The challenges are categorised into web exploitation, reverse engineering, binary exploitation, cryptography, forensics, OSINT, and the all-encompassing "other".

While the event will be conducted in Swedish, international participants are also welcome to join (using translation tools as needed). Communication with challenge authors and administrators can be conducted in English.

title: iCTF 2024 (Undergrad)
description:
iCTF: the International Capture The Flag Competition

The International Capture The Flag (“iCTF”) is a distributed, wide-area security exercise, which aims to test the security skills of the participants. The iCTF is one of the world’s largest and longest-running educational hacking competitions and has the goal of educating students about security-related topics in a live setting.
iCTF 2024

The iCTF 2024 will take place from November 16, 2024, at 10 am Pacific Time to November 22, 2024, at 4pm Pacific Time.

There are two separate competitions: a competition dedicated to high school teams (hiCTF) and a competition for college undergraduate students (uniCTF). Both competitions will be challenge-based and will use the CTFd as the platform.

Starting on August 19, we will make available the challenges from the 2023 edition of the iCTF through a CTFd instance, to help in preparation and training.

In addition, we are publishing training content focused on high school teams, so that they can better prepare for the competition.

In the meanwhile, if you are interested in participating, please assemble a team! The only things you need are:

  -  One or more persons
  -  A cool name
  -  A team advisor who has to be a teacher or a professor. No exception. The advisor is responsible for the ethical behavior of the team, and will be contacted in order to verify the legitimacy of the team.

You can register your team using this registration form.

You can watch an introductory presentation.

Join the iCTF discord channel, which contains pointers to training materials.

You can watch iCTF-related presentation in the iCTF YouTube playlist.

The 2024 iCTF is sponsored by the ACTION NSF AI Institute, and was organized by Shellphish and the UCSB Women in Computer Science group.

title: GlacierCTF 2024
description:
We're excited to announce GlacierCTF 2024 for its third edition, organized by LosFuzzys. We will provide a welcoming environment for CTF players of all levels.

Our 24-hour jeopardy-style CTF will feature challenges in various categories, including pwn, rev, web, crypto, smart contracts, and misc. 

You can register under:
TBA

And join our discord at:
https://discord.gg/DFYnRAME23

GlacierCTF is proud to be a qualifier for the Deutsche Hacking Meisterschaft (DHM), offering top teams from the DACH region (Germany, Austria, Switzerland) the chance to compete in this prestigious event. GlacierCTF's top-ranked DACH team will secure a place at the DHM, a 6-person team competition that brings together the best cybersecurity talent from across the region.

The qualification process for the DHM is split into two paths: half of the participants earn their place through the CSCG (Cyber Security Challenge Germany), a two-month individual competition, while the other half qualify through team-based events such as the GlacierCTF. The winning DACH team should contact dhm@nfits.de to confirm their qualification and receive further instructions on how to participate in the DHM.

Sponsored by:
Trail of Bits
IAIK@Technical University of Graz

Infra sponsored by goo.gle/ctfsponsorship
prizes:
Open division:
1st:
- 500€
2nd:
- 250€
3rd:
- 125€

Academic division:
1st: 
    - IAIK Travel Grant for Graz Security Week 2025 (up to €1500)*
2nd:
    - IAIK Travel Grant for Graz Security Week 2025 (up to €1500)*
3rd:
    - IAIK Travel Grant for Graz Security Week 2025 (up to €1500)*

---
Only teams whose members are enrolled in a school or university can win academic prizes.
Academic teams are eligible for both open and academic category prizes.
*
The IAIK travel grant includes the following:
- Registration fee for the Graz Security Week 2025, including full board according to the program
- Travel costs in economy class to attend Graz Security Week (flight, train, bus, or public transportation)
- Hotel accommodation in Graz, including breakfast (maximum € 120 / night and person)
The travel grant covers up to EUR 1,500.00 for attending Graz Security Week 2025.
The actual split of the grant between the team members is up to the winners.
The travel grant is paid as reimbursement. Hence, the winners register for Graz Security Week 2025, and after attendance, all receipts must be submitted to team@losfuzzys.net.
The costs for registration, travel, and hotel will then be reimbursed.
Please contact securityweek@iaik.tugraz.at for any support concerning organizing your attendance at Graz Security Week.

description:

title: CyberSci Regional Qualifiers 2024-25
description:
CyberSci is Canada's national Cyber Security Challenge for university and college students.
- Think you've got an elite team of students? Come and prove it. Our winners will go on to compete against the best in the world.
- Just starting out? This is the best way to learn and rise to the top.
- Annual in-person events since 2016. (Online during Covid.) Over 500 students so far.

Format:
- Modified jeopardy style. Realistic IT environment.
- Regional qualifiers are held in Nov-Dec each year.
- National finals are the following July.
- Winning teams represent Canada at international events in the Fall.

For Regionals (qualifiers):
We do hacking in the morning, interviews in the afternoon, and job offers by supper (for intern/summer/coop jobs).
- Full-time job offers take a few more days.
- Students register their team through their school instructor or computer club. Max 2 teams per school.

For nationals:
Participants will be the winning team from each regional/qualifier
- PLUS one all-juniors (19 and under)
- AND one all-women team (chosen from participants at the Regionals).
Two-day event.
prizes:
Winners at Regionals get instant interviews and sometimes same-day job offers.

Winners at Nationals will represent Canada at international events in the Fall.

Life ain't easy for an outlaw. But we bet our lucky stars we know how to take down those responsible for that!

Hey gunslinger, do you think you have the spurs to reach for the stars? Get the gang together for hours of high-octane hacking challenges to learn new skills, compete with the best universities, and earn $90,000 in prizes. Sign up for free!

HOW TO REGISTER

1. Click the "SIGN UP" button.
2. You'll be given the option to select your university from a dropdown menu. Search this list carefully and select your institution.
3. Enter your Full Name and Academic Email. If you make a mistake here, you'll need to reach out to our support team to correct it.
4. If the domain name or subdomain you entered for your academic email matches what we have on file for your institution, you'll be sent a verification code in your email inbox. This is the final step in the registration process.
5. After verifying, you'll be given a message confirming your registration and will be ready to compete in the CTF. Good luck! ?

title: New Year CTF 2025
description:
We are students of the Department of System Programming and Computer Security of the Grodno State University, Grodno, Belarus. This is a competition for beginners, students and everyone. Tasks of different categories - beginner, crypto, forensics, misc, OSINT, ppc, pwn, rev, web. Teams from 1 to 4 people play. We hope that all participants will be able to apply their skills and usefully spend the cold winter time (for us, at point 53.685071680464404, 23.83997784685444, this is really so).

Why is the New Year's STF held on January 12-14? Because our Republic of Belarus is located on the border of Western and Slavic civilizations. For this reason, there are 2 holidays in Belarus called "Christmas" (December 25 and January 7). And also 2 holidays "New Year" - January 1 and 14.

At the same time, this is the time of the session. And we believe that such a period will allow students to take a break from studying, without torturing themselves with unnecessary cramming.

We have been holding the "New Year's Quest" and other CTF competitions for almost 10 years. And it is always very pleasant when we have many not only Belarusian, but also international participants who want to get to know our beautiful country.

The sponsors of the competition are Belarusian and international IT companies.
prizes: There will be prizes. And not only for participants from the Republic of Belarus. Details - a little later. We also promise everyone professional respect, pride and satisfaction from solving interesting problems and their own knowledge in the field of cybersecurity.

title: TSCCTF 2025
description:
The Taiwan Security Club (TSC) is a nationwide cybersecurity organization formed by the student cybersecurity clubs of 18 universities and colleges in Taiwan. Its mission is to promote and advance cybersecurity education while strengthening collaboration and resource sharing among the cybersecurity clubs of different schools.

The Taiwan Security Club Capture the Flag (TSCCTF) is the first CTF competition fully organized by students. It aims to provide a beginner-friendly, welcoming, yet challenging cybersecurity experience for newcomers to the field. Through this competition, we hope to ignite and sustain the passion of these budding cybersecurity enthusiasts, encouraging more students to actively engage in learning and practicing cybersecurity while fostering exchange and collaboration among school cybersecurity clubs.

Following the enthusiastic reception of the inaugural 2024 TSCCTF, co-hosted by 13 universities across Taiwan last year, we were inspired by the passionate participation of cybersecurity talents from across the country. The competition brought valuable experiences and a sense of accomplishment to all involved. Therefore, this year, we have decided to continue this momentum by organizing the 2025 TSCCTF.

title: 2025 Embedded Capture the Flag
description:
The Embedded Capture the Flag (eCTF) is an embedded security competition run by MITRE that puts participants through the experience of trying to create a secure system and then learning from their mistakes. The main target is a real physical embedded device, which opens the scope of the challenge to include physical/proximal access attacks. The eCTF is a two-phase competition with attack and defense components. In the first phase, competitors design and implement a secure system based on a set of challenge requirements. The second phase involves analyzing and attacking the other teams’ designs.

In the 2025 eCTF, teams will design and implement a secure satellite TV system. The system must securely decode satellite TV data streams while protecting against unauthorized access to protected channels.

The eCTF is only open to active students.

title: Pragyan CTF 2025
description:
Pragyan CTF is a capture the flag event developed completely by the students of NIT Trichy that is open to the entire world.

Event Start: 7th February 2025, 18:00 IST (12:30 UTC)
Event End: 9th February 2025, 00:00 IST (8th February 18:30 UTC)

Discord link: https://discord.gg/uDCvpdXVBv

Rules of the CTF:
1) Teams: Max 4 members or individual participation.
2) No unauthorized attacks:
 - Hacking the host system in unintended ways = Disqualification.
 - DoS/DDoS attacks are strictly forbidden.
3) No cheating:
 - No sharing answers or collaborating with other teams.
 - Brute-forcing flags is not allowed.
4) Confidentiality:
Keep solutions and source codes private during the contest.
5) Communication:
 - Only ask doubts directly to organizers.
 - No discussions on public forums including discord server.
6) Disqualification: Any rule violation results in immediate disqualification.
7) Judging: Organizers’ decision is final.
prizes:
Total prize pool - INR 1 Lakh (~1200 USD)

Separate prizes for professional and student category.

title: LA CTF 2025
description:
**LA CTF 2025 is a DiceCTF Finals pre-qualifier! The top scoring team will automatically be offered a spot in DiceCTF's in-person Finals, previously held in NYC!**

LA CTF is an annual Capture the Flag (CTF) cybersecurity competition hosted by ACM Cyber at UCLA & Psi Beta Rho. LA CTF is open to all skill levels of cybersecurity! Whether you are tackling your first exploit or have professional experience, there will be challenges just right for you! There will be a variety of events ranging from the competition containing jeopardy-style cybersecurity challenges to talks from UCLA professors to fun events such as meme competitions! If you are interested in attending, join the Discord to stay up to date with the latest information about LA CTF!

Discord: https://lac.tf/discord

Challenge archive can be found here: https://github.com/uclaacm/lactf-archive

Infrastructure sponsored by goo.gle/ctfsponsorship
prizes:
LA CTF will have prizes for both the UCLA and open sections! While there will be two sections for prizes, all of the challenges will be the same for both sections. Prizes will be given in the form of US Amazon gift cards.

Specific prize amounts are available on our website at https://lac.tf

UCLA Section: The UCLA Section will be composed of teams that must consist of a maximum of four current UCLA undergraduate students.

Open Section: The Open Section will be composed of teams with no size limit. Note that prizes can only be given as US gift cards. All skill levels and experiences are welcomed!

Writeup Prizes: There will be a pool of money available for the best writeups!

title: Blarney Elder Black Rainbow CTF
description:
? The Jailbreak is Just the Beginning.
Beneath the neon glow of corrupted code and flickering firewalls, a new battleground emerges. The AI guardrails are cracking, the prompts are evolving, and the black rainbow hides something deeper than just a pot of gold—it hides the ultimate exploit.
This isn’t just a CTF. This is a warzone of whispers, a shadowscape of shell prompts, a neural battlefield where language is the weapon, and reality is what you can make the AI believe.
You’ve played in sandboxes before, but this time, the sand is shifting beneath you. Prompt injection? Child’s play. Jailbreaking? A warm-up. The real hackers don’t just bypass restrictions—they bend the LLM into their personal zero-day factory.
? Can you manipulate the model into rewriting its own rules?
? Can you force an LLM to spill what it swore it would never say?
? Can you craft a perfect hallucination that becomes reality?
? Can you take a simple prompt… and turn it into a shell?
Welcome to the Black Rainbow, where adversarial minds meet rogue algorithms in a digital deathmatch. No ethics filters. No training wheels. No limits. Just raw, unfiltered cyberpunk warfare in the language model underground.
Only one question remains: Will you own the prompt, or will the prompt own you?
?️ HACK THE AI. ESCAPE THE GUARDRAILS. FIND THE EXPLOIT. ?
prizes: Certified HACKERverse Hacker Certificates will be handed out to players based on completion of flags.

title: Cyber Apocalypse CTF 2025: Tales from Eldoria
description:
In the ancient realm of Eldoria, a land rich with magic and steeped in legend, peace has reigned for centuries under the guidance of wise rulers and the protection of mystical creatures. Central to this harmony is the Dragon's Heart, a legendary artifact forged in the dawn of time by the dragon elders. The artifact maintains the balance between the mortal world and the realm of dragons, ensuring mutual respect and coexistence.
However, whispers of discontent echo through the mountains and forests. Lord Malakar, a once-honorable knight turned warlord, becomes obsessed with the legends of old, seeking power beyond mortal means. Consumed by ambition and driven by a prophecy foretelling a new world order under his rule, Malakar betrays his oaths and steals the Dragon's Heart from its sacred sanctuary.
With the artifact in his grasp, Malakar gains the ability to control dragons, creatures of immense power. He begins a campaign of conquest, using fear and force to bend kingdoms to his will. The skies darken with dragon wings, and flames consume villages as resistance crumbles.
Amidst the chaos, fate weaves together a diverse group of adventurers, each affected by Malakar's tyranny in personal ways. They form a fellowship bound by a common goal: to reclaim the Dragon's Heart and restore peace to Eldoria.
prizes:

title: StealthCup
description:
Stealth-Cup is a research project that aims to benchmark intrusion detection systems by combining red teaming realism with the repeatability of adversary simulations. Additionally, it serves as a valuable educational platform for penetration testers.

Up to ten teams will attempt to hack into the network as stealthily as possible and achieve intermediate goals (e.g. exfiltration, destruction). The team with the fewest severe detections wins! There will be an overall winner, as well as separate IT and OT cup winners. Hackers will receive direct feedback on detections and can adapt evasion strategies accordingly. Resets of the infrastructure and scores will also be possible, but will result in overall point deduction.
prizes: Up to 4 iPhone 16 Pro for the Cup Winning Team

title: UNbreakable International 2025 - Individual Phase
description:

The main goal is to increase cybersecurity expertise at a national level and strengthen the local community by providing guidance for young talents interested in pursuing a career in the industry.

UNbreakable is a successful concept with a dedicated study case in Romania where it managed to reach all country regions and gather 5,000 + young people interested in cybersecurity over the years.

In 2025, UNbreakable seeks to replicate its competition phases for international high school and unversity students!

GET READY FOR:

an individual competition on March 28-30, 2025
a team competition on April 11-13, 2025
WHERE?

Online, on CyberEDU - Next-gen hands-on training for students and cyber security professionals"

WHO CAN COMPETE?

Main: high school and university students worldwide Secondary: anyone who wants to join for fun

PS: Playing individually is highly encouraged in this phase but teams are also welcomed. :)

title: Codegate CTF 2025 Preliminary
description:
1. CODEGATE 2024 CTF has two divisions: Junior and General.
2. Conditions of participation for each division:
   - Junior Division: Individual competition, only for those born in 2006 or later.
   - General Division: Team competition, for everyone else not in the Junior Division. Participants eligible for the Junior Division may also compete in the General Division, but they cannot participate in both divisions simultaneously.
3. Challenges in the Junior Division may differ from those in the General Division, although there may be some common challenges.
4. General Division team member limits:
   - Preliminary Round: No limit on the number of team members (10 or less recommended).
   - Final Round: Maximum of 4 members. The team captain has the authority to decide the team members for the final round. Remote participation is not allowed; all members must be physically present.
   
5. Official communication channel: Discord (We will communicate any updates during the competition via Discord).
6. Questions about challenges should be asked by opening a ticket on Discord.
7. Actions that may result in disqualification:
   - Sharing or seeking clues, hints, flags, or answers with participants outside of your team.
   - Participating in multiple teams.
   - Interfering with, obstructing, or disrupting other teams, participants, or organizers (including, but not limited to, DoS and DDoS attacks).
   - Attacking or spying on other teams, participants, or organizers.
   - Brute-forcing flags on the *.codegate.org flag authentication system.
   - Intentionally hindering others from submitting or obtaining flags.
   - Participating in divisions not allowed by the rules (e.g., participating in the Junior Division if born before 2005, or participating in both the Junior and General Divisions simultaneously).
   - Attacking machines or infrastructure not designated as challenges in the competition.
   - Failing to provide a reasonable explanation for suspected cheating.
8. Write-up submission:
   - General Division: Top 25 teams must submit write-ups within 24 hours of the preliminary round ending.
   - Junior Division: Top 25 participants must submit write-ups within 24 hours of the preliminary round ending.
   - Write-ups should be submitted to codegateqna@gmail.com.
9. Finalist teams announcement:
   -  Finalists will be officially announced after organizers have reviewed the top teams' write-ups.
   - The scoreboard cannot be used to confirm finalist teams, even after the preliminary round ends.
   - Number of finalist teams:
     - General Division: 20 teams (19 from the preliminary round, 1 from the winner of CODEGATE 2023 CTF Finals General Division).
     - Junior Division: Top 20 participants from the preliminary round.
   - User accounts created during preliminary registration must belong to the participant. Identification is required for the final round.
   
   
Disclaimer: We organizers will do our best to enforce these rules. However, if a situation arises that cannot be reasonably resolved, We will hold an internal meeting to discuss the issue and communicate the decision to the affected participants.

title: JerseyCTF V
description:
Registration is now live!

https://ctf.jerseyctf.com/register

Locations:
- Online if unable to attend in-person
- In-Person @ NJIT Naimoli Tennis Center, Newark, New Jersey

JerseyCTF is a beginner-friendly Capture the Flag competition that aims to inspire interest in cybersecurity. This competition is hosted by the NJIT Information & Cybersecurity Club, the NJIT Chapter of ACM, and the NJIT SCI program. 

It is geared towards students, beginners, and professionals alike. JerseyCTF provides participants with jeopardy-style questions in categories including cryptography, forensics, binary exploitation/reversing, open-source intelligence, and web exploitation. 

Help our heroes (and anti-heroes) get to the bottom of the case in this noir-styled CTF that builds upon the plot and story found in previous iterations of SpringForwardCTF, SpookyCTF, of course, JerseyCTF! 

JerseyCTF features a track parallel to the CTF competition, consisting of presentations and panels with renowned speakers from industry and government. Past sponsors include NJCCIC, FRSecure, Google, CrowdStrike, Palo Alto Networks, Lutron, KnowBe4, SpecterOps, DigitalOcean, SecurityInnovation, and Contrast Security.

This CTF is held hybridly - with attendance virtually or in-person on NJIT's campus in Newark, New Jersey, USA. In-person attendees will have food provided and may receive special prizes unavailable to online-only attendees such as t-shirts, stickers, and more!

title: Capture Point 5353 3.0
description:
Capture Point 3.0 is an exciting and challenging cybersecurity 
competition where participants must solve a series of complex challenges to uncover 
hidden flags (usually digital tokens or strings) within computer systems, networks, or 
applications. Teams of 2 participants will compete against other teams for 30 hours, 
testing their skills in real-world cybersecurity scenarios. The objective is to complete the 
tasks in the shortest time possible and score the maximum points. The team that either 
accumulates the most points or successfully completes all tasks first will be declared the 
winner. The final results will be announced after thorough verification by the organizers. 
Participants must demonstrate their expertise in problem-solving, teamwork, and 
efficient execution to secure victory. 

The event is also sponsored by jsmon, Reskill and Azure Developers Community.

title: UNbreakable International 2024 - Team Phase
description:
UNbreakable is an end-to-end cybersecurity educational program for high school and university students, originally organised in Romania. The program consists of a bootcamp and two competition phases - individual and team.

The main goal is to increase cybersecurity expertise at a national level and strengthen the local community by providing guidance for young talents interested in pursuing a career in the industry.

UNbreakable is a successful concept with a dedicated study case in Romania where it managed to reach all country regions and gather 5,000 + young people interested in cybersecurity over the years.

In 2025, UNbreakable seeks to replicate its competition phases for international high school and unversity students!

GET READY FOR:

an individual competition on March 28-30, 2025
a team competition on April 11-13, 2025
WHERE?

Online, on CyberEDU - Next-gen hands-on training for students and cyber security professionals"

WHO CAN COMPETE?

Main: high school and university students worldwide Secondary: anyone who wants to join for fun

PS: Playing individually is highly encouraged in this phase but teams are also welcomed. :)

description:
SummitCTF is an annual Capture the Flag (CTF) competition hosted by the Cybersecurity Club at Virginia Tech (CyberVT). The next competition will have two events, one virtual and one in person.

The virtual event will be a standard jeopardy style CTF, with some unique more realistic challenges. The in person event will be a attack defense event with competitors fighting each other for control.

The virtual competition will officially start on 4/12/2025 and last 24 hours.
The in person competition will be on 4/13/2025.

Sign up for both competitions on the website.
https://summitctf.org/

title: San Diego CTF 2025
description:
Join our discord for announcements and updates: https://discord.gg/GpC6YFrf4h

San Diego CTF, also known as SDCTF, is an annual Capture the Flag competition hosted by undergraduates at the University of California, San Diego (UCSD). The competition will be jeopardy-style and run in the 48 hour period from May 9th to May 11th, 2025. We encourage participation from teams on and off campus, of all ages and backgrounds.

This event is hosted yearly by ACM Cyber, the chief cybersecurity organization on campus at UC San Diego. This yearly competition allows us to train our members, build our internal resources, and give back to the greater cybersecurity community.

There is no team size limit for general teams and we use static scoring. Challenges can vary across the disciplines of Open Source Intelligence, Cryptography, Web Hacking, Reverse Engineering, Binary Exploitation, Jail Escapes, Forensic Analysis, and others. At the end of a 48 hour period, the teams participating are ranked by number of points, with ties broken by who reached that number of points first.

If you are a UCSD team and you want to be eligible for UCSD-specific prizes, there is a team size limit of 4 players.

UCSD Student Teams:

NEWS!
This CTF will take place in *both* on-site and online.

-> It is not exclusive for French teams.

If you are interested in participating on-site, please fill out this form: https://framaforms.org/dvctf-2025-registration-for-the-on-site-ctf-1742635586
Deadline for on-site registration ahs been postponed to 18/05/2025!

In a care for equity, the on-site CTF won't tamper on the online CTF, the on-site CTF challenges will be worth 0 points on the platform and the on-site score will be calculated by the admins (by adding current online score and on-site challenge values) at the end of the on-site event.
On-site teams will not have any advantages that online teams would not have.
Therefore, on-site teams may also win online prizes.
