title: N0PSctf
description:
N0PSctf is back!

This year, Jojo needs your help again. He received an emergency call from Noopsy, a fellow inhabitant of N0PStopia, a cartoonish cyberworld.

The three evil Lords of PwnTopia, CrypTopia and WebTopia attacked N0PStopia and are now planning to extend their conquest. They MUST be stopped before it is too late!!

Since you saved him last year, Jojo answered the call and thought about you. Will you be able to stop this threatening threat ?

Come from May 31st to June 1st, 2025 to face our new batch of Web, Crypto, Reverse, Pwn, Misc and more challenges!

Register now via https://ctf.nops.re/
prizes:
For the top 3 student-only teams : your adventure through N0PStopia wouldn’t be complete without some epic souvenirs to bring back home!

    1st Place : A special OffSec pack containing one access to SEC-100, and two one-year accesses to PG Practice
    2nd Place : A Root-Me one year premium subscription
    3rd Place : A Root-Me 50% discount on premium subscription

For the top 5 teams : N0PSctf and Root-Me Pro goodies await you, plus a special surprise straight from the heart of N0PStopia! ?

To top it all off, we will select the best overall write-up, the most creative one, and the most unexpected one with an exclusive prize awaiting their authors in the competition! : a certification of the player's choice from SecOps Group.

title: Cyber Lumen x GWK #CTF1
description:
? Purpose
Select top 30 women with natural offensive cybersecurity skills through practical challenge-based evaluation. LEVEL is early beginners and FEMALE only

? Format
Hybrid event: Onsite at KITRI War Room (Seoul) and remote participation - https://en.kitribob.kr/

? Organizers & Host Platform
• FKCA (French Korean Cyber Alliance) – strategic coordination and leadership.
• RALFKAIROS – operational lead for CyberLumen program.
• Kairos (FKCA Member) – technical organizer of the event, platform deployment, and content provision via Purple
Hackademy CTF infrastructure.
• Global Women in Korea – community outreach and participant recruitment.

? Guest Speakers
• Jay Turla (DEFCON, RootCon)
• Yi-Ting Shen, Security Researcher | Conference Speaker | AI/ML Researcher | PenTest
• Professor KW Lee - Korean Academic Expert in Cybersecurity
• Eunkyung  Lee - Security Researcher of Korea Internet & Security Agency (KISA)
• Jay Turla - Principal Security Researcher (Automotive) at VicOne
• Hyuna Lee - Ransomware Researcher / CTF Player at SK Shieldus
• Azam Ahmad - President Advisory board at FKCA

? Partners
• FKCA
• RALFKAIROS
• Global Women in Korea (GWK)
• Root-Me PRO (platform sponsor)
• BoB KITRI (host sponsor)
? Location
KITRI War Room (Seoul) – up to 80 participants with PC availability, microphone, and full-day venue access.

? Timeline
Saturday, June 21, 2025
Event runs from 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM KST.
? Target Participants
• Female students from Korean universities
• Members of the Global Women in Korea network
• Beginners welcome – focus on logic, creativity, and potential.
? Participant Objectives
• Verify their interest in shifting careers to offensive cybersecurity—even without prior exposure.
• Learn how to generate side income via bug bounty platforms.
• Understand offensive cyber career paths through expert talks.
• Test their natural aptitudes through beginner-friendly CTF challenges.
• Discover training programs in ethical hacking and coding.
• Meet cybersecurity companies in Korea interested in emerging female talent.
prizes:
For the Top 30 ladies
- Free tuition fee (=10.000 euros) for 3-month Offensive Security full time camp in Seoul in Cyber Lumen for beginners. online & part time are also possible - (June 23 - Sept 23) 
- Accommodation and travel not included
- Top 5 participants will receive personal introductions to hiring companies upon completion of CyberLumen's 3–6
month career path.

title: Hack The System - Bug Bounty CTF
description:
2 Very Easy,
2 Easy &
1 Medium Web Challenges

The digital world has been overtaken by The Patchwork, a sprawling virtual network designed to safeguard global infrastructure. At its center lies The Architect, an AI originally created to defend the internet from vulnerabilities. But The Architect has gone rogue, exploiting critical flaws to sow breaches, chaos, and catastrophic data loss. Its relentless attacks threaten to plunge humanity into the Cyber Dark Ages, where no data, system, or network can be trusted.
You are one of The Hunters. Armed with your expertise in web vulnerabilities, you must hack into high-profile institutions such as universal banking apps, healthcare systems, and global data repositories that have been compromised by The Architect. By exploiting the vulnerable systems, you can identify and mitigate flaws, dismantling The Architect’s control piece by piece.
prizes: Certified Bug Bounty Hunter(CBBH) certification for the top team

title: Junior.Crypt.2025 CTF
description:
Junior.Crypt.2025 CTF — an open cybersecurity competition for university students, college and school students, and anyone interested. This is a 48-hour online event. We hope all participants will be able to fully apply their skills and have a great time.  

The CTF is organized by students from the Department of System Programming and Computer Security at Yanka Kupala State University of Grodno, Grodno, Belarus.  

Team participation is required, with teams consisting of 1-4 members. Challenges will cover various categories—beginner, cryptography, forensics, miscellaneous, OSINT, ppc, pwn, rev, and web.  

The official languages of the tournament are Russian and English. However, you can still participate even if you don’t speak either. We will do our best to ensure that every task is understandable with machine translation. Additionally, throughout the competition, we will introduce participants to the extraordinary beauty of our country—the Republic of Belarus.
prizes: Unfortunately, we do not have a huge prize fund :) Participants from Belarus will receive prizes from our sponsors. We promise everyone professional respect, pride and satisfaction from solving interesting problems and new knowledge in the field of cybersecurity.

title: HITCON Cyber Range 2025 Quals
description:
HITCON Cyber Range is one of Taiwan's benchmark challenges for Blue Teams, testing not only technical depth but also the limits of teamwork and on-the-spot reaction. Through HITCON Cyber Range, you will:
Experience the most realistic cybersecurity incident response processes.
Hone investigation skills to uncover the truth from subtle clues.
Enhance practical defense capabilities against real-world threats.


## Organisations
Advising Organisation: Administration for Digital Industries, Ministry of Digital Affairs
Organisers: Association of Hackers in Taiwan (HIT) / Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI)

## Competition Description
The HITCON Cyber Range competition will proceed in two main stages: first, the Global Online Qualifiers, followed by the On-site Finals held in Taiwan. Participating teams must pass the challenges of the Online Qualifiers to be eligible for the Finals.

## Important Dates (All times are UTC+8)
Registration Deadline: June 30, 2025 (Monday) 23:59
Global Online Qualifiers: July 18, 2025 (Friday) 10:00 - 23:59 (14 hours total)
Announcement of Finalists and Details: September 1, 2025 (Monday)
Offline Finals & Award Ceremony: October 17, 2025 (Friday)

## Finals Qualification Rules
A minimum of 10 teams are expected to advance to the Finals.
Qualification slots include:
- Top 5 domestic corporate teams from the Online Qualifiers.
- 2 teams recommended by F-ISAC.
- 3 reserved slots for international teams.
- On-site Finals & Award Ceremony Venue

Venue: Taipei New Horizon Building, 6F Function Room
- Address: 6F, No. 88, Yanchang Road, Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan

## Contact Information
- If you have any questions, please feel free to contact the HITCON Cyber Range team via Email: cyberrange@hitcon.org

## Awards and Recognition
I. Qualifiers
Teams that meet the eligibility criteria and fully participate in the "Online Qualifiers" will each receive one HITCON Cyber Range digital certificate of participation.

II. Finals Ranking Awards
- Teams that advance to the Finals and finish in the top-three will receive trophies and cash prizes:
- Champion (1st Place): One team trophy + Prize money: USD $3,000 
- Runner-up (2nd Place): One team trophy + Prize money: USD $1,500
- Third Place: One team trophy + Prize money: USD $600

III. Exclusive Benefits for Finalist Teams
All teams successfully advancing to the "On-site Finals" will enjoy the following exclusive benefits:
- Exclusive Souvenirs: Special HITCON Cyber Range memorabilia representing honor and the journey.
- Finals Participation Certificate: Issuance of individual and corporate certificates for Finals participation.
- Team Performance Report: A detailed post-competition analysis report provided to aid in review and growth.
- Networking Party Seats: Five (5) seats provided per team for the post-competition networking dinner to interact with cybersecurity experts and peers.

IV. Award Ceremony
- The award ceremony will be held immediately following the conclusion of the Offline Finals competition segment, celebrating and recognizing the winning teams.


## Registration Details
I. Eligibility Criteria
To ensure the competition focuses on enhancing practical internal cybersecurity defense capabilities within enterprises, participating teams must meet the following qualifications:

- Team Composition:
   1. Each team may have a maximum of 4 members. 
   2. One member must be designated as the team captain and primary contact.
   3. This person may be a team member or a non-participating individual.

- Affiliation Requirements:
   1. All members must belong to the same company or organization.
   2. Cross-company/organization teams are strictly prohibited.
   3. This competition does not allow teams formed by individuals participating in a personal capacity.
- Company/Organization Eligibility Restrictions:
   1. Enterprises/organizations registering must not have their primary core business in providing external cybersecurity consulting, cybersecurity products, managed security services, or related professional cybersecurity services (i.e., they must not be cybersecurity Vendors / MSSPs / Consultant Firms). The competition aims to enhance the defensive and response capabilities of non-cybersecurity industries themselves.
   2. A single enterprise/organization (based on its Tax ID number or specific legal entity) is limited to registering only one representative team. If multiple teams from the same enterprise are interested in participating, they must complete internal coordination beforehand to nominate a single representative team. If multiple registrations from the same enterprise appear in the system, the organizers will recognize the team that 'first completed the registration process' according to system records as the official participant representative. No further coordination will be undertaken by the organizers.

II. Registration Schedule (All times are UTC+8)
- Registration Deadline: June 30, 2025 (Monday) 23:59
- Eligibility Review Notification: Team captains will be notified of the review results via Email, expected by July 11, 2025 (Friday).

III. Registration Method
- Registration Platform:
   1. This competition uses online registration exclusively. Please complete the registration process on the KKTIX registration system during the registration period.
   2. Registration Link: hitcon.kktix.cc/events/hitcon-cyberrange-2025
Review and Notification:
   3. The organizers will conduct eligibility reviews after the registration deadline based on the criteria mentioned above.
   4. Review results (regardless of approval status) and subsequent pre-competition notices, important information, etc., will all be sent via Email to each team captain.

## Competition Format and Rules
HITCON Cyber Range aims to simulate realistic cybersecurity attack and defense scenarios and is divided into two stages: "Online Qualifiers" and "On-site Finals".

### Stage 1: Online Qualifiers

- Core Focus: Incident Investigation and Threat Identification
   1. This stage is conducted online and primarily assesses the team's cybersecurity incident investigation and analysis capabilities.
   2. Participating teams need to analyze various forms of digital evidence provided by the organizers (e.g., network traffic, server logs, endpoint activity records) to uncover hacker traces, identify real attack incidents, and find key Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).

- Recommended Skills:
   1. Familiarity with log interpretation for common operating systems (Windows/Linux) and network devices (Firewall/Proxy).
   2. Ability to read and understand SQL query syntax and PowerShell scripts.
   3. Understanding of common hacker techniques and the ability to apply the MITRE ATT&CK® framework for analysis.

- Procedure:
   1. Format: Online challenges.
   2. Time: July 18, 2025 (Friday) 10:00 to 23:59 (UTC+8, 14 hours total).
   3. Accounts: Each team will receive 4 login accounts for members to solve challenges online concurrently.
   4. Environment: Using the latest version of Chrome or Edge browser is recommended for the best experience.

- Advancement to Finals:
   1 .Qualifier scores will be ranked based on points earned and completion time. Top-ranking teams will advance to the On-site Finals.

### Stage 2: On-site Finals
- Core Focus: Comprehensive Incident Response Practice
   1. This stage is an on-site competition designed to test the team's overall cybersecurity Incident Response (IR) capabilities under the pressure of a simulated enterprise environment.
   2. Tasks include: Alert analysis, in-depth attack chain investigation, and formulating and actually implementing response measures (e.g., isolating compromised hosts, removing malware, patching system vulnerabilities, strengthening security settings).

- Recommended Team Composition:
   1. The Finals challenges are diverse. It is recommended that team members possess complementary professional backgrounds and practical skills, including:
   2. IT Operations and System Administration (Server, Network, AD/DC Management)
Application Security and Management
   3. Cybersecurity Expertise (SOC Monitoring & Analysis, Incident Response IR, Digital Forensics)

- Procedure:
​​​​​​​   1. Format: On-site competition held at the designated venue.
   2. Time: (UTC+8) October 17, 2025 (Friday) 10:00 to 16:00 (UTC+8, 6 hours total).
       (Detailed competition schedule, will be notified to finalist teams before the event).
   3. Venue: Taipei New Horizon Building, 6F Function Room(6F, No. 88, Yanchang Road, Xinyi District, Taipei City).
   4. Detailed procedures for the Finals competition, operating environment, scoring criteria, and important notes will be informed separately to the qualifying teams before the Finals.

## Prohibited Actions
To maintain the fairness and integrity of the competition, all participating teams and members must adhere to the following rules. Violators may face immediate disqualification from participation or award eligibility:
- Any action undermining the fairness of the competition is prohibited: This includes, but is not limited to, exchanging, leaking, purchasing, or disseminating solutions (Flags), hints, or solving methods in any form between teams.
- Attacking or disruptive behavior is prohibited: Strictly forbidden are any forms of network attacks, malicious scanning, denial-of-service attacks, or unauthorized access attempts against the competition platform, related infrastructure, staff, or other participating teams.
- Prohibition of participating in multiple teams: Each participant may only register for and represent one team.
- The organizers reserve the final right to determine and act upon any violations.

## Important Notes
Registrants are required to carefully read the following consent forms:

- Association of Hackers in Taiwan (HIT) and Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI) Personal Data Collection, Processing, and Use Notification and Consent Form
- Administration for Digital Industries, Ministry of Digital Affairs Personal Data Collection, Processing, and Use Notification and Consent Form

title: ENOWARS 9
description:
The 9th installation of the epic ENOWARS trilogy!

More details on our landing page

ENOWARS's top-ranked DACH team will also secure a spot at the 2026 DHM. The DHM (Deutsche Hacking Meisterschaft) is a 6-person team competition focused on fostering the best cybersecurity talent from across Germany. The qualification process for the DHM is split into two paths: half of the participants earn their place through the CSCG (Cyber Security Challenge Germany), a two-month individual competition, while the other half qualify through team-based events like this one. The winning DACH team should contact dhm@nfits.de to confirm their qualification and receive further instructions on how to participate.
prizes:
A big thank you to Zellic for sponsoring ENOWARS 9: 

First-blooding any flagstore makes you eligible for a 50$ writeup prize! The prize can be redeemed by submitting a corresponding writeup via ctftime. In the case that a team forfeits their eligibility, we may award the next team by flag submission time.

title: ToH CTF 2025
description:
Welcome to ToH CTF 2025! We are Tower of Hanoi, a CTF team based in Milan, founded back in 2004. You might remember us from past events such as poliCTF, last hosted in 2017.

Now we're back, bringing you an exciting event for all skill levels and interests. This year's competition includes challenges across the main categories: Pwn, Rev, Web, Crypto, and Misc.

title: StackSmash CTF
description:
In the retro kingdom of SegFaultia, chaos has erupted. The dastardly Heap Hopper, a rogue programmer turned villain, has kidnapped Princess Pomegrante and locked her away in the infamous Stack Dungeon, a fortress built entirely of corrupted memory stacks and unstable code.
The kingdom’s last hope is Super Jumpio, a daring, mustachioed hero known for his incredible leaps and unmatched debugging skills. Armed with his Binary Boots and trusty Debugger Hat, Super Jumpio must navigate through levels of vulnerable code, leaping over buffer overflows, smashing through bad pointers, and outwitting Heap Hopper’s dynamic linker traps. To prevail, Super Jumpio must jump, debug, and smash his way to victory, rescuing the Princess and restoring stability to SegFaultia!
prizes: Silver Annual Academy Subscription for the winning team

title: BelkaCTF #7
description: BelkaCTF is a digital forensics CTF held by Belkasoft, the vendor of Evidence Center X forensic toolkit. Unravel an investigation story by solving a series of diverse DFIR challenges. The CTF is open to both professional forensic analysts and enthusiastic amateurs. * * * — Damn these blue screens to hell! — The Chief sucked on his cigar so hard I thought his lungs would surrender first. — Half the country's on pause! — Airports, hospitals, power plants… all crashed into that lovely blue abyss, — I nodded, lazily jamming a USB stick into my laptop. — Except one terminal. — Which one? — The dispatcher's workstation at the airport. Didn't BSOD like the rest — instead, it runs some weird locker, blasting propaganda: "Hit the streets on this date, show 'em who's boss..." The Chief let out a dry chuckle: — So, detective, what's your take? — My take? This ain't some script kiddie brag. Someone's playing crowd control through hijacked Windows boxes. He exhaled smoke slowly, eyes gleaming: — Then it's time we find out who woke up the streets from behind a ransom screen. — Already on autopilot, Chief. Just don’t mess with my coffee mug.

title: PH03N1X V1P3R N0V4 CTF
description:
PH03N1X V1P3R N0V4 CTF a new ctf in town. A CTF with a twist. Because its aim is to teach rather than focus on competition side.The approach we’ll utilize is the following: during the 3 day competition at multiple points we’ll freeze the scoreboard, and well split the 40 teams in 2, so 20/20. Than say group A will have to teach or explain to group b a certain challenge randomly chosen. Now if group B manages to solve it they are still allowed to keep competing. If they don’t manage to solve it they won’t be allowed to continue the competition. This method encourages peer based learning. 
A physical presence unique event not only on the way the ctf takes place, but unique cause it's only one stage so no qualifiers.

Event will contain embedded pwn(arduino pwn+ re),space hacking(kudos to EthosLabsLLC), mainframe hacking(special thanks to soldier of fortran), bomb defusal, normal pwn, web, crypto ,forensics, powerpc,ic(cmos) revese engineering, nday development, docker escape, and car hacking, ics&scada(shoutout i0.rs group), browser pwn.  Event will be from 29-31 October, physically in Timisoara, Romania.

Currently looking for sponsors, current sponsor: @fuzzysec
prize sponsors: caido, metactf, cyberwarfare labs
media sponsors&partners: i0.rs, uav.ro, cyberedu, defcon Cluj,calpyso heavy industries
challenge sponsors: i0.rs, ethos labs, Alex Hornyai@ecsc team hungary, soldier of fortran,0xmard

Should you wish to participate in the event, please fill the form(https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdKO7QZKdwNRuakt7WoYnb6Fzq1Jxrx6fI8r8gJtdXDFkJRRA/viewform?usp=dialog) and join the discord . Please fill it only if you consider attending it very seriously !

If any problems should arise while filling in the form please reach @f00fc7c800 on twitter!

title: Sawah Cyber Security CTF 2025
description:
We invite you to participate in an exciting 4-hours Capture The Flag (CTF) Hacking competition in the beautiful island of Bali. This event is designed to be beginner friendly while still offering plenty of challenges for more experienced participants. Through a series of engaging, real-world cybersecurity challenges, you’ll gain practical experience, learn new techniques, and connect with like-minded individuals who share your passion for technology and cyber security.

Participants will face tasks across categories such as Web Exploitation, Reverse Engineering, Binary Exploitation, OSINT, and even AI-related challenges. Each challenge is carefully crafted to test your problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and cybersecurity knowledge.

This competition is hosted by PT Sawah Cyber Security as part of our initiative to promote cybersecurity awareness in Indonesia. We aim to bridge academic and professional communities by encouraging ethical hacking practices and industry-level skills. The event is open to universities, private companies, and independent participants alike, to grow interest and capabilities in the cybersecurity field.

description:

Step into the Blue Arena, a high-stakes digital warzone where only the sharpest minds will survive. Hosted by the renowned CSEM CTF platform, this forensics-specific Capture The Flag event challenges participants to dive deep into the world of cyber investigation and digital forensics.

In this one-of-a-kind arena, you'll face thrilling, real-world inspired challenges — from dissecting encrypted files and analyzing memory dumps to tracing digital footprints and unmasking hidden artifacts in compromised systems. Your investigative instincts, speed, and precision will be pushed to the edge.

Whether you're a cybersecurity student, an experienced analyst, or an ethical hacker with a passion for digital truth-seeking, the Blue Arena is your battlefield to showcase your skills, compete with global minds, and rise as a true cyber forensics warrior.

? Key Highlights:
? Forensics-only CTF challenges

? Memory analysis, file carving, log tracing, OSINT, and more

? Compete with elite participants from across the nation

? Live scoreboard, rewards, and certificates for top performers

? Immersive platform hosted on CSEM CTF

Are you ready to investigate, analyze, and conquer the arena?
Join the Blue Arena — where every byte tells a story.

title: DefCamp Capture the Flag (D-CTF) 2025 Quals
description:
Mark Your Calendars! The DefCamp Capture the Flag (D-CTF) Qualification Phase is Locked and Loaded for 2025!

Get ready to dive into the most electrifying and audacious security CTF competition in Central and Eastern Europe—DefCamp Capture The Flag (D-CTF)!

This is where the sharpest hackers and IT masterminds come together to push their skills to the limit, battling it out with top CTF teams from around the globe. The mission? Secure a spot in the elite top 10 and ultimately conquer the D-CTF competition—or go down fighting!

Since 2011, DefCamp Capture the Flag has been the ultimate battleground for over 10,000 players. This annual, multi-stage event is open to all, but remember one crucial rule—hack or be hacked!

Event Highlights
Brace yourselves for an adrenaline-packed adventure with around 10 beginner-friendly challenges and 15 more difficult tasks that will test even the most seasoned players.

Format: Jeopardy
Play Format: Team-only
Genres: Crypto, Pwning, Reversing, Web, Forensics, Miscellaneous…
Language: English
Access: Open / Free for everyone
Difficulty: Entry Level - Easy - Medium - Hard - Insane

The Challenge Awaits

Tackle a variety of challenges across multiple categories.
Exploit system weaknesses, follow cryptic hints, and uncover hidden secrets.
Each challenge holds a unique flag in the format CTF{sha256 random message}. Capture it, submit it on our platform, and rack up your points.
CTF competitions are a thrilling mix of puzzles and challenges, including reverse-engineering, memory corruption, cryptography, web tech, and more. Solve them, capture the flag, and climb the leaderboard to victory!

Organizers & Partners
This epic event is brought to you by the Cyber Security Research Center from Romania (Asociatia Centrul de Cercetare in Securitate Informatica din Romania) under the banner of DefCamp, Romania's largest and most vibrant INFOSEC community.
prizes:
Best international teams in the global ranking and top teams from Romania are invited to the grand finale of DefCamp 2025, one of the largest and most anticipated cybersecurity conferences in the region.

The event will take place from November 12-13 in Bucharest, Romania for the 15th time.

The final showdown will feature an intense 1-day Attack-Defence exercise, and maybe even a sprinkle of Jeopardy! ?

Qualification
Up to 15 teams will be invited to compete for glory in Bucharest, Romania, at the D-CTF 2025 Final.
Up to 3 teams from Romania will also secure a spot in the final
Finalists will receive free tickets to DefCamp 2025.

Full or partial accommodation reimbursement will be provided.

Main Prizes - International (for the final, onsite):
- 1st place: €1,536
- 2nd place: €1,024
- 3rd place: €512
- Best Team from Romania: €512
Other Prizes (online and onsite):
- Best Write-up (1 prize each for online and onsite): €512, available only to the top 30 teams.

title: Ctrl+Space CTF Quals
description:
Ctrl+Space CTF is the first European in-orbit Capture the Flag competition. The event is a joint collaboration between the European Space Agency (ESA), D-Orbit, and the mhackeroni team, who are also responsible for creating the challenges.

The competition consists of an online qualification round featuring space-themed jeopardy-style tasks, followed by an on-site final held during the Security for Space Systems (3S) Conference, taking place at ESTEC in the Netherlands from 4 to 6 November 2025. 

Finalists will face real-time security challenges executed directly aboard D-Orbit’s ION Satellite Carrier, orbiting Earth in real time.

Ctrl+Space CTF is supported by the ESA Security Office and the ESA Security Cyber Centre of Excellence (SCCoE).

Join the discord: https://discord.gg/pkcCP34GPE

title: CDCTF 2025
description:
Crimson Defense CTF 2025 will be held on Saturday, September 20th from 10am to 10pm CDT!

CDCTF is a virtual 12-hour Jeopardy-style Capture-the-Flag competition designed for collegiate-level players. All ability levels are welcome. 

This competition will not only provide satisfying challenges for seasoned players, but be a good introduction to CTFs for new ones!

CDCTF is a team competition, you may have up to four participants per team. Universities may have multiple teams representing their school.

There will be challenges of all difficulties representing the following categories: Reverse Engineering, Log & Network Traffic Analysis, Forensics, Password Cracking, Cryptography, Open Source Intelligence, and more!

Registration is open! The link is on our website: https://uacrimsondefense.github.io/cdctf.html

CDCTF is hosted and created by Crimson Defense Cyber Security Club at the University of Alabama.
prizes: First, second, and third place teams will receive awards to commemorate their achievement!

title: Holmes CTF 2025
description:
Event Overview
Welcome to HTB’s first-ever Blue CTF! This gauntlet of Sherlock-style challenges leads you through a case that has yet to be solved! 

Joining this event will allow you to investigate a range of scenarios: 

Threat Intelligence
SOC
DFIR
Malware Reversing 

With a team of 5, use your collective wit to dive into this forensic mystery and resolve an issue plaguing the city of Cogwork-1. 
Use your ace intellect to solve the crimes in Cogwork-1


Consider this our official debrief. 

Holmes left some vague context (as he does) before heading out into the field. Here’s what we know: 

We are getting strange readings from around the city; there were some targeted attacks on local businesses that seemed off. Who was chosen and the type of attack piqued Holmes’ interest, so he set out ahead of us. 

Odd though… he was muttering about something that had happened a while back, and he expressed distress about a personal AI he developed named WATSON. 

See, WATSON was his collaborative ally in his attempts to curb the crime happening around the city. However, some time ago, a catastrophic false-alert event caused by WATSON triggered a year-long manhunt for a breach that never existed. We were chasing ghosts.  

Reputations ruined. Careers ended. The entire city was paralyzed over a phantom that was in our own backyard. The event known as NULLINC caused Holmes to shut down his creation, his friend. 

So, we are just as confused about why he’d mention WATSON now, but you never can get a read on that man. 

Head out into the field and assist him in finding out what’s going on. We are counting on your detectives.
prizes:
PRIZE POOL
$10.000+

title: InfiniteCTF Qualifiers
description:
The Red Team Association is hosting an attack/defend CTF qualifier event on September 27th from 12 PM to 8 PM PST. 

Each team will receive an identical vulnerable system to authenticate to and secure. Teams must identify security vulnerabilities in their assigned system, then use their knowledge to exploit the same vulnerabilities in other teams' systems. 

Date: September 27th, 2025 Time: 12 PM - 8 PM PST (8 hours)

Registration: Open until the event begins 
Team Size: No limits 
Difficulty: Beginner/Intermediate 
Technical Requirements: SSH client only 
How It Works: Teams receive SSH credentials (key and IP address) to access their assigned vulnerable system. Flags rotate every minute, allowing teams to submit flags continuously for points. Teams are penalized for taking their services offline, so maintaining system availability while securing vulnerabilities is crucial. 
Qualification: The top 50 teams will be invited to compete in the multi-day InfiniteCTF Main Event on November 7th-8th. 

The Main Event is online and features significantly more systems and challenges ranging from beginner to advanced difficulty. 

The first place team will receive 5 Flipper Zeros, thanks to our sponsor Casco (https://casco.com). 

For questions, contact us on LinkedIn!
prizes: Top 50 teams gain entry to the main event, hosted by the Red Team Association, on Nov 7th-8th.

This is the second jailCTF event. Unlike traditional CTFs, this event has a large focus on "jail" challenges which ask players to escape out of a code sandbox with some set of restrictions applied. Categories here aren't traditional here either, with pyjail, esolang, and other mainstream languages as categories (js, perl, ruby, c, etc). Come and have fun in jailCTF!

Sponsored by Zellic!!! https://www.zellic.io/

Sponsored by OtterSec!!! https://osec.io/

More information about our sponsors can be found on https://ctf.pyjail.club/ and in the discord!

title: Standoff Cyberbattle 16
description:
Standoff is a large-scale cyber battle simulating real-world attacks and defenses on replicas of IT systems from various industries. Red and blue teams compete in a hyper-realistic virtual city, targeting or defending sectors like banking, energy, and telecom. Open to international teams only. Red teams test systems with any TTPs; blue teams investigate and respond to live attacks.

When: October 6–8  
Apply before: September 1

Standoff is not a classic attack-defense CTF. In terms of infrastructure, we're aiming to resemble real-world IT infrastructures instead of single VMs or tasks. In some ways, you can compare it with Pro Labs on Hack The Box. Our range consists of several of these infrastructures, each representing some kind of enterprise (e.g., a bank, an IT company, or even a metal production facility), and as an attacker, you'll have to breach the perimeter, perform some lateral movement inside, and then find and solve the tasks. You'll also have to fill out a pentest-like report on your actions to score.

The blue teams will either monitor their piece of infrastructure and write reports on incidents that occurred there, or, in some cases, they will actively counter the attackers by using EDR software.

Also, you can try out online ranges at https://standoff365.com/en-US/ to get an idea of what to expect at the main event.

Please contact https://x.com/amoshkov if you have any questions.
prizes:

title: Hackfest CTF 2025
description:
The HFCTF is only on premises at the Centre des Congrès de Québec, not online.

The CTF will last 24 hours non-stop for participants and will run from Thursday 19:30EST to Friday 19:30EST.

It's mandatory to purchase both a Hackfest Ticket and a HFCTF ticket to participate in the CTF (https://hackfest.ca/en/register).

You must join the official Hackfest Discord server in order to participate in the CTF (link: https://discord.hackfest.ca). On the day of the event, you'll need to sign in using your Discord account to access scoreboards and CTF infrastructure. 

The HFCTF is a 24 hours team event, so only teams of six will be allowed. Contestants that are not in a team or that have a team with fewer than six members will be mixed randomly to create tables of six people. You can ask on the Hackfest Discord if you have any questions about this. 

Teams are not managed in Eventbrite, so you can buy your tickets as you wish. Teams will be formed at the beginning of the event where you will create your team and declare a captain when you log in to the CTFd. More information will be given on the Discord.

Further details will also be on the Hackfest Discord. A dedicated channel for the HFCTF 2025 will be created with all the necessary information and support.

title: HITCON Cyber Range 2025 Final
description:
HITCON Cyber Range is one of Taiwan's benchmark challenges for Blue Teams, testing not only technical depth but also the limits of teamwork and on-the-spot reaction. Through HITCON Cyber Range, you will:
Experience the most realistic cybersecurity incident response processes.
Hone investigation skills to uncover the truth from subtle clues.
Enhance practical defense capabilities against real-world threats.


## Organisations
Advising Organisation: Administration for Digital Industries, Ministry of Digital Affairs
Organisers: Association of Hackers in Taiwan (HIT) / Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI)

## Competition Description
The HITCON Cyber Range competition will proceed in two main stages: first, the Global Online Qualifiers, followed by the On-site Finals held in Taiwan. Participating teams must pass the challenges of the Online Qualifiers to be eligible for the Finals.

## Important Dates (All times are UTC+8)
Registration Deadline: June 30, 2025 (Monday) 23:59
Global Online Qualifiers: July 18, 2025 (Friday) 10:00 - 23:59 (14 hours total)
Announcement of Finalists and Details: September 1, 2025 (Monday)
Offline Finals & Award Ceremony: October 17, 2025 (Friday)

## Finals Qualification Rules
A minimum of 10 teams are expected to advance to the Finals.
Qualification slots include:
- Top 5 domestic corporate teams from the Online Qualifiers.
- 2 teams recommended by F-ISAC.
- 3 reserved slots for international teams.
- On-site Finals & Award Ceremony Venue

Venue: Taipei New Horizon Building, 6F Function Room
- Address: 6F, No. 88, Yanchang Road, Xinyi District, Taipei City, Taiwan

## Contact Information
- If you have any questions, please feel free to contact the HITCON Cyber Range team via Email: cyberrange@hitcon.org

## Awards and Recognition
I. Qualifiers
Teams that meet the eligibility criteria and fully participate in the "Online Qualifiers" will each receive one HITCON Cyber Range digital certificate of participation.

II. Finals Ranking Awards
- Teams that advance to the Finals and finish in the top-three will receive trophies and cash prizes:
- Champion (1st Place): One team trophy + Prize money: USD $3,000 
- Runner-up (2nd Place): One team trophy + Prize money: USD $1,500
- Third Place: One team trophy + Prize money: USD $600

III. Exclusive Benefits for Finalist Teams
All teams successfully advancing to the "On-site Finals" will enjoy the following exclusive benefits:
- Exclusive Souvenirs: Special HITCON Cyber Range memorabilia representing honor and the journey.
- Finals Participation Certificate: Issuance of individual and corporate certificates for Finals participation.
- Team Performance Report: A detailed post-competition analysis report provided to aid in review and growth.
- Networking Party Seats: Five (5) seats provided per team for the post-competition networking dinner to interact with cybersecurity experts and peers.

IV. Award Ceremony
- The award ceremony will be held immediately following the conclusion of the Offline Finals competition segment, celebrating and recognizing the winning teams.


## Registration Details
I. Eligibility Criteria
To ensure the competition focuses on enhancing practical internal cybersecurity defense capabilities within enterprises, participating teams must meet the following qualifications:

- Team Composition:
   1. Each team may have a maximum of 4 members. 
   2. One member must be designated as the team captain and primary contact.
   3. This person may be a team member or a non-participating individual.

- Affiliation Requirements:
   1. All members must belong to the same company or organization.
   2. Cross-company/organization teams are strictly prohibited.
   3. This competition does not allow teams formed by individuals participating in a personal capacity.
- Company/Organization Eligibility Restrictions:
   1. Enterprises/organizations registering must not have their primary core business in providing external cybersecurity consulting, cybersecurity products, managed security services, or related professional cybersecurity services (i.e., they must not be cybersecurity Vendors / MSSPs / Consultant Firms). The competition aims to enhance the defensive and response capabilities of non-cybersecurity industries themselves.
   2. A single enterprise/organization (based on its Tax ID number or specific legal entity) is limited to registering only one representative team. If multiple teams from the same enterprise are interested in participating, they must complete internal coordination beforehand to nominate a single representative team. If multiple registrations from the same enterprise appear in the system, the organizers will recognize the team that 'first completed the registration process' according to system records as the official participant representative. No further coordination will be undertaken by the organizers.

II. Registration Schedule (All times are UTC+8)
- Registration Deadline: June 30, 2025 (Monday) 23:59
- Eligibility Review Notification: Team captains will be notified of the review results via Email, expected by July 11, 2025 (Friday).

III. Registration Method
- Registration Platform:
   1. This competition uses online registration exclusively. Please complete the registration process on the KKTIX registration system during the registration period.
   2. Registration Link: hitcon.kktix.cc/events/hitcon-cyberrange-2025
Review and Notification:
   3. The organizers will conduct eligibility reviews after the registration deadline based on the criteria mentioned above.
   4. Review results (regardless of approval status) and subsequent pre-competition notices, important information, etc., will all be sent via Email to each team captain.

## Competition Format and Rules
HITCON Cyber Range aims to simulate realistic cybersecurity attack and defense scenarios and is divided into two stages: "Online Qualifiers" and "On-site Finals".

### Stage 1: Online Qualifiers

- Core Focus: Incident Investigation and Threat Identification
   1. This stage is conducted online and primarily assesses the team's cybersecurity incident investigation and analysis capabilities.
   2. Participating teams need to analyze various forms of digital evidence provided by the organizers (e.g., network traffic, server logs, endpoint activity records) to uncover hacker traces, identify real attack incidents, and find key Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).

- Recommended Skills:
   1. Familiarity with log interpretation for common operating systems (Windows/Linux) and network devices (Firewall/Proxy).
   2. Ability to read and understand SQL query syntax and PowerShell scripts.
   3. Understanding of common hacker techniques and the ability to apply the MITRE ATT&CK® framework for analysis.

- Procedure:
   1. Format: Online challenges.
   2. Time: July 18, 2025 (Friday) 10:00 to 23:59 (UTC+8, 14 hours total).
   3. Accounts: Each team will receive 4 login accounts for members to solve challenges online concurrently.
   4. Environment: Using the latest version of Chrome or Edge browser is recommended for the best experience.

- Advancement to Finals:
   1 .Qualifier scores will be ranked based on points earned and completion time. Top-ranking teams will advance to the On-site Finals.

### Stage 2: On-site Finals
- Core Focus: Comprehensive Incident Response Practice
   1. This stage is an on-site competition designed to test the team's overall cybersecurity Incident Response (IR) capabilities under the pressure of a simulated enterprise environment.
   2. Tasks include: Alert analysis, in-depth attack chain investigation, and formulating and actually implementing response measures (e.g., isolating compromised hosts, removing malware, patching system vulnerabilities, strengthening security settings).

- Recommended Team Composition:
   1. The Finals challenges are diverse. It is recommended that team members possess complementary professional backgrounds and practical skills, including:
   2. IT Operations and System Administration (Server, Network, AD/DC Management)
Application Security and Management
   3. Cybersecurity Expertise (SOC Monitoring & Analysis, Incident Response IR, Digital Forensics)

- Procedure:
​​​​​​​   1. Format: On-site competition held at the designated venue.
   2. Time: (UTC+8) October 17, 2025 (Friday) 10:00 to 16:00 (UTC+8, 6 hours total).
       (Detailed competition schedule, will be notified to finalist teams before the event).
   3. Venue: Taipei New Horizon Building, 6F Function Room(6F, No. 88, Yanchang Road, Xinyi District, Taipei City).
   4. Detailed procedures for the Finals competition, operating environment, scoring criteria, and important notes will be informed separately to the qualifying teams before the Finals.

## Prohibited Actions
To maintain the fairness and integrity of the competition, all participating teams and members must adhere to the following rules. Violators may face immediate disqualification from participation or award eligibility:
- Any action undermining the fairness of the competition is prohibited: This includes, but is not limited to, exchanging, leaking, purchasing, or disseminating solutions (Flags), hints, or solving methods in any form between teams.
- Attacking or disruptive behavior is prohibited: Strictly forbidden are any forms of network attacks, malicious scanning, denial-of-service attacks, or unauthorized access attempts against the competition platform, related infrastructure, staff, or other participating teams.
- Prohibition of participating in multiple teams: Each participant may only register for and represent one team.
- The organizers reserve the final right to determine and act upon any violations.

## Important Notes
Registrants are required to carefully read the following consent forms:

- Association of Hackers in Taiwan (HIT) and Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI) Personal Data Collection, Processing, and Use Notification and Consent Form
- Administration for Digital Industries, Ministry of Digital Affairs Personal Data Collection, Processing, and Use Notification and Consent Form

In this jeopardy-style CTF, every challenge is themed around osu! and popular rhythm games. title: PH03N1X V1P3R N0V4 CTF
description:
PH03N1X V1P3R N0V4 CTF a new ctf in town. A CTF with a twist. Because its aim is to teach rather than focus on competition side.The approach we’ll utilize is the following: during the 3 day competition at multiple points we’ll freeze the scoreboard, and well split the 40 teams in 2, so 20/20. Than say group A will have to teach or explain to group b a certain challenge randomly chosen. Now if group B manages to solve it they are still allowed to keep competing. If they don’t manage to solve it they won’t be allowed to continue the competition. This method encourages peer based learning. 
A physical presence unique event not only on the way the ctf takes place, but unique cause it's only one stage so no qualifiers.

Event will contain embedded pwn(arduino pwn+ re),space hacking(kudos to EthosLabsLLC), mainframe hacking(special thanks to soldier of fortran), bomb defusal, normal pwn, web, crypto ,forensics, powerpc,ic(cmos) revese engineering, nday development, docker escape, and car hacking, ics&scada(shoutout i0.rs group), browser pwn.  Event will be from 29-31 October, physically in Timisoara, Romania.

Currently looking for sponsors, current sponsor: @fuzzysec
prize sponsors: caido, metactf, cyberwarfare labs
media sponsors&partners: i0.rs, uav.ro, cyberedu, defcon Cluj,calpyso heavy industries
challenge sponsors: i0.rs, ethos labs, Alex Hornyai@ecsc team hungary, soldier of fortran,0xmard

Please note that the dates for the event change from 29-31 to 28-30

Should you wish to participate in the event, please fill the form(https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdKO7QZKdwNRuakt7WoYnb6Fzq1Jxrx6fI8r8gJtdXDFkJRRA/viewform?usp=dialog) and join the discord or visit pwnctf.ro. Please fill it only if you consider attending it very seriously !

If any problems should arise while filling in the form please reach @f00fc7c800 on twitter!

title: Ctrl+Space CTF Finals
description:
The final event of Ctrl+Space CTF, the first European in-orbit Capture the Flag. The competition is a collaboration between the European Space Agency (ESA), D-Orbit, and the mhackeroni team.

This final round will take place on site at ESA ESTEC (Netherlands) during the ESA Security for Space Systems (3S) Conference, from 4 to 6 November 2025.

Finalists will compete in space-themed challenges developed by mhackeroni, including:
- On-ground challenges
- In-orbit challenges executed on D-Orbit’s ION Satellite Carrier, orbiting Earth in real time
- King of the Hill

The event is supported by the ESA Security Office and the ESA Security Cyber Centre of Excellence (SCCoE).

title: RootCipher
description:
RootCipher is a two-day online cybersecurity event organized by THUNDERCIPHER in collaboration with ROOTX.
Day 1 (8 Nov 2025) is a practical workshop day with industry speakers — Raj Kumar Mullapudi and Sandip Banerjee — delivering focused sessions on real-world offensive & defensive techniques. Day 2 (9 Nov 2025) is an online Jeopardy-style Capture The Flag (CTF) that tests web, crypto, forensics, reversing, and pwn skills across a range of difficulty levels.

Who should join

Students, hobbyists, and professionals who want practical, hands-on experience.

Beginners looking for approachable challenges and guided learning.

Intermediate and advanced players seeking competitive puzzles and real-world scenarios.

Format & rules (summary)

Format: Online — Jeopardy-style CTF.

Duration: Single competitive day on 9 Nov 2025 (exact start time announced on the registration page in IST).

Team size: Individual or teams (recommended max: 4 members).

Scoring: Standard dynamic scoring with hints and progressive solves. No disruptive attacks; fair-play required. Detailed rulebook will be available before the CTF start.

Registration required: All participants must register via the official form (link below). Participation is free unless otherwise stated.

Prizes & recognition

Top prizes (including: CRTP voucher for 1st place) and digital certificates for top finishers. Additional swag and community recognitions to be announced.

Important links & contact

Registration: https://forms.thundercipher.tech/form/949b7b32-ff49-400e-9194-a91a5deeb910

Organizer: THUNDERCIPHER — https://thundercipher.tech
 (official pages and socials)

Contact / Questions: organiser email or Discord listed on registration page.

Why attend
RootCipher blends instructor-led workshops with an accessible, well-structured Jeopardy CTF — ideal for learners who want to convert workshop theory into practice, and for CTF players who want a well-run online competition with meaningful prizes and community recognition.
prizes: 1st Winner - CRTP Voucher

title: Crate-CTF 2025
description:
Crate-CTF is an annual Capture The Flag (CTF) competition organised by the Swedish Defence Research Agency in collaboration with the Swedish Armed Forces, designed to introduce high school and university students to the field of cybersecurity. After having over 1000 participants last year we return for our sixth CTF, with challenges for all skill levels from beginners to seasoned CTF players. The challenges are categorised into web exploitation, reverse engineering, binary exploitation, cryptography, forensics, OSINT, networking and the all-encompassing "other".

While the event will be conducted in Swedish, international participants are also welcome to join (using translation tools as needed). Communication with challenge authors and administrators can be conducted in English.

title: CyberSci Regional Qualifiers 2025-26
description:
CyberSci is Canada's national Cyber Security Challenge for university and college students.
- Think you've got an elite team of students? Come and prove it. Our winners will go on to compete against the best in the world.
- Just starting out? This is the best way to learn and rise to the top.
- Annual in-person events since 2016. (Online during Covid.) Over 500 students so far.

Format:
- Modified jeopardy style. Realistic IT environment.
- Regional qualifiers are held in Nov-Dec each year.
- National finals are the following July.
- Winning teams represent Canada at international events in the Fall.

For Regionals (qualifiers):
We do hacking in the morning, interviews in the afternoon, and job offers by supper (for intern/summer/coop jobs).
- Full-time job offers take a few more days.
- Students register their team through their school instructor or computer club. Max 2 teams per school.

For nationals:
Participants will be the winning team from each regional/qualifier
- PLUS one all-juniors (19 and under)
- AND one all-women team (chosen from participants at the Regionals).
Two-day event.
prizes:
Winners at Regionals get instant interviews and sometimes same-day job offers.

Winners at Nationals will represent Canada at international events in the Fall.

title: GlacierCTF 2025
description:
We're excited to announce GlacierCTF 2025 for its fourth edition, a 24-hour jeopardy CTF organized by LosFuzzys.

You can register under:
https://play.glacierctf.com/

And join our discord at:
https://discord.gg/DFYnRAME23

Sponsored by:
- Hex-Rays (hex-rays.com)
- ISEC @ Graz University of Technology (isec.tugraz.at)

Infra sponsored by goo.gle/ctfsponsorship
prizes:
== Open bracket ==

1st:
    - 3x IDA Pro Expert-2 licenses
    - Hex-Rays swag (notebooks & t-Shirts, up to 5 team members)
2nd:
    - 1x IDA Pro Expert-2 license
3rd:
    - 1x IDA Pro Expert-2 license

The top-ranked team from the DACH region (Germany, Austria, and Switzerland) will also qualify for the Deutsche Hacking Meisterschaft (DHM).

== Academic bracket ==

1st: 
    - ISEC Travel Grant for Graz Security Week 2026 (up to €1500)*
2nd:
    - ISEC Travel Grant for Graz Security Week 2026 (up to €1500)*
3rd:
    - ISEC Travel Grant for Graz Security Week 2026 (up to €1500)*

---
Only teams whose members are enrolled in a school or university can win academic prizes.
Academic teams are eligible for both open and academic category prizes.
* The ISEC travel grant includes the following:
- Registration fee for the Graz Security Week 2026, including full board according to the program
- Travel costs in economy class to attend Graz Security Week (flight, train, bus, or public transportation)
- Hotel accommodation in Graz, including breakfast (maximum € 120 / night and person)
The travel grant covers up to EUR 1,500.00 for attending Graz Security Week 2026.
The actual split of the grant between the team members is up to the winners.
The travel grant is paid as reimbursement. Hence, the winners register for Graz Security Week 2026, and after attendance, all receipts must be submitted to team@losfuzzys.net.
The costs for registration, travel, and hotel will then be reimbursed.
More information about the Graz Security Week: https://securityweek.at/
Please contact securityweek.isec@tugraz.at for any support concerning organizing your attendance at Graz Security Week.

---
Legal prize elegibility: Teams from countries that are sanctioned by the Austrian government or the European Union are exempt from receiving any prizes. To ensure this policy, winnes might have to provide proof of citizenship or enrolment at a university.

title: Infosec University Hackathon 2025
description:
? Join India’s Premier Virtual Cyber Security Hackathon! ?
We are excited to announce the return of the Infosec University Hackathon 2025, hosted by Synchrony in collaboration with the Cybersecurity Centre of Excellence (CCoE) Hyderabad for all college students in India.

As cyber threats evolve rapidly, the future demands skilled defenders who can think creatively and act decisively. At Synchrony, we are dedicated to empowering the next generation of cybersecurity professionals — and this hackathon is your gateway to step into that future. ?

Whether you're passionate about threat hunting, cryptography, digital forensics, or building secure technology — this is your arena to prove your skills, compete with the best, and win incredible rewards ? including a chance to intern with Synchrony!
Who can participate? Open to all students pursuing Bachelor’s, Diploma, and Master’s degrees who are eager to build and test their cybersecurity skills.

Take the leap and become a part of India’s strongest cyber talent force!
? Register Now: https://syfinfosechackathon.info/
? Last Date to Register: November 21, 2025
? Qualifier Round: November 23, 2025
? Grand Finale: November 29 & 30, 2025
Let’s secure the future together! ?✨

Competitors will solve challenges across seven categories: web, OSINT, reverse engineering, binary exploitation (pwn), cryptography, forensics, and misc.

SecurITy Challenge – VianuCTF 2025 is a cybersecurity competition for students, organized by the “Tudor Vianu” National College of Computer Science in Bucharest, Romania, together with the Vianu Cybersecurity Club.

The event promotes cybersecurity education by helping students develop the technical skills and knowledge needed to stay safe in the digital world, while also sparking interest in the field among young people.

Participants will tackle complex cybersecurity scenarios, think critically, and craft effective solutions to protect systems and data.

CTF Format: Jeopardy

The contest includes challenges from all major categories — Web, Pwn, Crypto, Reverse Engineering, Misc, Forensics, OSINT, and more!

- Secondary Schools (On-site eligibility required)
- High Schools (On-site eligibility required)
- Universities (On-site eligibility required)

description:
The New Year's CTF 2026, organized by the Beavers0 team from Grodno State University in Belarus, is a competition that has already become a tradition for many.

title: 2026 Embedded Capture the Flag
description:
The Embedded Capture the Flag (eCTF) is an embedded security competition run by MITRE that puts participants through the experience of trying to create a secure system and then learning from their mistakes. The main target is a real physical embedded device, which opens the scope of the challenge to include physical/proximal access attacks. The eCTF is a two-phase competition with attack and defense components. In the first phase, competitors design and implement a secure system based on a set of challenge requirements. The second phase involves analyzing and attacking the other teams’ designs.

In the 2026 eCTF, teams will design and implement a secure storage solution for a chip foundry. The system must allow users with various roles to access the proper data without leaking sensitive chip designs to unauthorized parties.

The eCTF is only open to active students.

title: PHONIX VIPER NOVA CTF#2
description:
Second edition of Phonix Viper Nova CTF. A physical unique event not only on the way the ctf takes place, but unique cause it's only one stage so no qualifiers.
This time in Bucharest, not Timisoara. Bigger, better and bolder. This time we include 150 challenges, split in 2 tracks easy and hard. Total prize pool of 6000 euro. For hard track the following prizes: 

1. 2000 euro
2. 1500 euro
3. 1000 euro

And for the easy track:

1. 750 euro
2. 500 euro
3. 250 euro

We keep same dynamic of mentorship only for the easy track, which is made of the following rule: during the 3 day competition at multiple points we’ll freeze the scoreboard, and well split the teams in 2, so 50/50. Than say group A will have to teach or explain to group b a certain challenge randomly chosen. Now if group B manages to solve it they get a lower amount of points and group A gets an extra 50 points. They have on hour to get extra points if they manage to solve that challenge . 

For the advanced track, it will be classic jeopardy.

What can you expect this year ?

Same topics plus some inovation: We keep the car hacking, bomb defusal, satellite hacking and mainframe hacking. We add fault injection, robot hacking. For new and or seasoned players they don't have to fear to participate because we also include pwn, web, crypto , rev, forensics.

You can also expect arduino and embedded pwn, docker escape, ics&scada too.

Please visit pwnctf.ro for more information, or join the discord server.

If any problems should arise while filling in the form please reach @f00fc7c800 on twitter!
prizes:
For hard track the following prizes: 

1. 2000 euro
2. 1500 euro
3. 1000 euro

And for the easy track:

1. 750 euro
2. 500 euro
3. 250 euro

Special thanks to NxP for sponsorship.
